1.verse: Blessed is the man that walketh not in the counsel of the ungodly, nor standeth in the way of sinners,

2.verse: But his delight is in the law of the LORD ;

3.verse: And he shall be like a tree planted by the rivers of water,

4.verse: The ungodly are not so:

5.verse: Therefore the ungodly shall not stand in the judgment,

6.verse: For the LORD knoweth the way of the righteous:

1.verse: Why do the heathen rage,

2.verse: The kings of the earth set themselves, and the rulers take counsel together,

3.verse: Let us break their bands asunder,

4.verse: He that sitteth in the heavens shall laugh:

5.verse: Then shall he speak unto them in his wrath,

6.verse: Yet have I set my king upon my holy hill of Zion.

7.verse: I will declare the decree: the LORD hath said unto me,

8.verse: Ask of me, and I shall give thee the heathen for thine inheritance,

9.verse: Thou shalt break them with a rod of iron;

10.verse: Be wise now therefore, O ye kings:

11.verse: Serve the LORD with fear,

12.verse: Kiss the Son, lest he be angry, and ye perish from the way,

1.verse: LORD , how are they increased that trouble me!

2.verse: Many there be which say of my soul,

3.verse: But thou, O LORD , art a shield for me;

4.verse: I cried unto the LORD with my voice,

5.verse: I laid me down and slept;

6.verse: I will not be afraid of ten thousands of people,

7.verse: Arise, O LORD ; save me, O my God:

8.verse: Salvation belongeth unto the LORD :

1.verse: Hear me when I call, O God of my righteousness:

2.verse: O ye sons of men, how long will ye turn my glory into shame?

3.verse: But know that the LORD hath set apart him that is godly for himself:

4.verse: Stand in awe, and sin not:

5.verse: Offer the sacrifices of righteousness,

6.verse: There be many that say,

7.verse: Thou hast put gladness in my heart,

8.verse: I will both lay me down in peace, and sleep:

1.verse: Give ear to my words, O LORD ,

2.verse: Hearken unto the voice of my cry, my King, and my God:

3.verse: My voice shalt thou hear in the morning, O LORD ;

4.verse: For thou art not a God that hath pleasure in wickedness:

5.verse: The foolish shall not stand in thy sight:

6.verse: Thou shalt destroy them that speak leasing:

7.verse: But as for me, I will come into thy house in the multitude of thy mercy:

8.verse: Lead me, O LORD , in thy righteousness because of mine enemies;

9.verse: For there is no faithfulness in their mouth;

10.verse: Destroy thou them, O God; let them fall by their own counsels;

11.verse: But let all those that put their trust in thee rejoice:

12.verse: For thou, LORD , wilt bless the righteous;

1.verse: O LORD , rebuke me not in thine anger,

2.verse: Have mercy upon me, O LORD ; for I am weak:

3.verse: My soul is also sore vexed:

4.verse: Return, O LORD , deliver my soul:

5.verse: For in death there is no remembrance of thee:

6.verse: I am weary with my groaning; all the night make I my bed to swim;

7.verse: Mine eye is consumed because of grief;

8.verse: Depart from me, all ye workers of iniquity;

9.verse: The LORD hath heard my supplication;

10.verse: Let all mine enemies be ashamed and sore vexed:

1.verse: O LORD my God, in thee do I put my trust:

2.verse: Lest he tear my soul like a lion, rending it in pieces,

3.verse: O LORD my God, if I have done this;

4.verse: If I have rewarded evil unto him that was at peace with me;

5.verse: Let the enemy persecute my soul, and take it ;

6.verse: Arise, O LORD , in thine anger, lift up thyself because of the rage of mine enemies:

7.verse: So shall the congregation of the people compass thee about:

8.verse: The LORD shall judge the people: Judge me, O LORD ,

9.verse: Oh let the wickedness of the wicked come to an end;

10.verse: My defence is of God,

11.verse: God judgeth the righteous,

12.verse: If he turn not, he will whet his sword;

13.verse: He hath also prepared for him the instruments of death;

14.verse: Behold, he travaileth with iniquity,

15.verse: He made a pit, and digged it,

16.verse: His mischief shall return upon his own head,

17.verse: I will praise the LORD according to his righteousness:

1.verse: O LORD our Lord, how excellent is thy name in all the earth!

2.verse: Out of the mouth of babes and sucklings hast thou ordained strength because of thine enemies,

3.verse: When I consider thy heavens, the work of thy fingers,

4.verse: What is man, that thou art mindful of him?

5.verse: For thou hast made him a little lower than the angels,

6.verse: Thou madest him to have dominion over the works of thy hands;

7.verse: All sheep and oxen,

8.verse: The fowl of the air, and the fish of the sea,

9.verse: O LORD our Lord,

1.verse: I will praise thee , O LORD , with my whole heart;

2.verse: I will be glad and rejoice in thee:

3.verse: When mine enemies are turned back,

4.verse: For thou hast maintained my right and my cause;

5.verse: Thou hast rebuked the heathen, thou hast destroyed the wicked,

6.verse: O thou enemy, destructions are come to a perpetual end:

7.verse: But the LORD shall endure for ever:

8.verse: And he shall judge the world in righteousness,

9.verse: The LORD also will be a refuge for the oppressed,

10.verse: And they that know thy name will put their trust in thee:

11.verse: Sing praises to the LORD , which dwelleth in Zion:

12.verse: When he maketh inquisition for blood, he remembereth them:

13.verse: Have mercy upon me, O LORD ; Consider my trouble which I suffer of them that hate me,

14.verse: That I may shew forth all thy praise in the gates of the daughter of Zion:

15.verse: The heathen are sunk down in the pit that they made:

16.verse: The LORD is known by the judgment which he executeth:

17.verse: The wicked shall be turned into hell,

18.verse: For the needy shall not alway be forgotten:

19.verse: Arise, O LORD ; let not man prevail:

20.verse: Put them in fear, O LORD :

1.verse: Why standest thou afar off, O LORD ?

2.verse: The wicked in his pride doth persecute the poor:

3.verse: For the wicked boasteth of his heart's desire,

4.verse: The wicked, through the pride of his countenance, will not seek after God:

5.verse: His ways are always grievous; Thy judgments are far above out of his sight:

6.verse: He hath said in his heart, I shall not be moved:

7.verse: His mouth is full of cursing and deceit and fraud:

8.verse: He sitteth in the lurking places of the villages:

9.verse: He lieth in wait secretly as a lion in his den:

10.verse: He croucheth, and humbleth himself,

11.verse: He hath said in his heart, God hath forgotten:

12.verse: Arise, O LORD ; O God, lift up thine hand:

13.verse: Wherefore doth the wicked contemn God?

14.verse: Thou hast seen it ; for thou beholdest mischief and spite, to requite it with thy hand:

15.verse: Break thou the arm of the wicked

16.verse: The LORD  is King for ever and ever:

17.verse: LORD , thou hast heard the desire of the humble:

18.verse: To judge the fatherless and the oppressed,

1.verse: In the LORD put I my trust:

2.verse: For, lo, the wicked bend their bow, they make ready their arrow upon the string,

3.verse: If the foundations be destroyed,

4.verse: The LORD  is in his holy temple,

5.verse: The LORD trieth the righteous:

6.verse: Upon the wicked he shall rain snares, fire and brimstone, and an horrible tempest:

7.verse: For the righteous LORD loveth righteousness;

1.verse: Help, LORD ; for the godly man ceaseth;

2.verse: They speak vanity every one with his neighbour:

3.verse: The LORD shall cut off all flattering lips,

4.verse: Who have said, With our tongue will we prevail;

5.verse: For the oppression of the poor,

6.verse: The words of the LORD  are pure words:

7.verse: Thou shalt keep them, O LORD ,

8.verse: The wicked walk on every side,

1.verse: How long wilt thou forget me, O LORD ? for ever?

2.verse: How long shall I take counsel in my soul, Having sorrow in my heart daily?

3.verse: Consider and hear me, O LORD my God:

4.verse: Lest mine enemy say, I have prevailed against him;

5.verse: But I have trusted in thy mercy;

6.verse: I will sing unto the LORD , because he hath dealt bountifully with me.

1.verse: The fool hath said in his heart, there is no God.

2.verse: The LORD looked down from heaven upon the children of men,

3.verse: They are all gone aside, they are all together become filthy:

4.verse: Have all the workers of iniquity no knowledge?

5.verse: There were they in great fear:

6.verse: Ye have shamed the counsel of the poor,

7.verse: Oh that the salvation of Israel were come out of Zion!

1.verse: LORD , who shall abide in thy tabernacle?

2.verse: He that walketh uprightly,

3.verse: He that backbiteth not with his tongue, nor doeth evil to his neighbour,

4.verse: In whose eyes a vile person is contemned;

5.verse: He that putteth not out his money to usury,

1.verse: Preserve me, O God:

2.verse: O my soul , thou hast said unto the LORD ,

3.verse: But to the saints that are in the earth,

4.verse: Their sorrows shall be multiplied that hasten after another god:

5.verse: The LORD  is the portion of mine inheritance and of my cup:

6.verse: The lines are fallen unto me in pleasant places ;

7.verse: I will bless the LORD , who hath given me counsel:

8.verse: I have set the LORD always before me:

9.verse: Therefore my heart is glad, and my glory rejoiceth:

10.verse: For thou wilt not leave my soul in hell;

11.verse: Thou wilt shew me the path of life: In thy presence is fulness of joy;

1.verse: Hear the right, O LORD , attend unto my cry,

2.verse: Let my sentence come forth from thy presence;

3.verse: Thou hast proved mine heart; thou hast visited me in the night; Thou hast tried me, and shalt find nothing;

4.verse: Concerning the works of men, by the word of thy lips

5.verse: Hold up my goings in thy paths, that my footsteps slip not.

6.verse: I have called upon thee, for thou wilt hear me, O God:

7.verse: Shew thy marvellous lovingkindness, O thou that savest by thy right hand them which put their trust in thee

8.verse: Keep me as the apple of the eye,

9.verse: From the wicked that oppress me,

10.verse: They are inclosed in their own fat:

11.verse: They have now compassed us in our steps:

12.verse: Like as a lion that is greedy of his prey,

13.verse: Arise, O LORD , disappoint him, cast him down:

14.verse: From men which are thy hand, O LORD , from men of the world,

15.verse: As for me, I will behold thy face in righteousness:

1.verse: I will love thee, O LORD , my strength.

2.verse: The LORD  is my rock, and my fortress, and my deliverer;

3.verse: I will call upon the LORD , who is worthy to be praised:

4.verse: The sorrows of death compassed me,

5.verse: The sorrows of hell compassed me about:

6.verse: In my distress I called upon the LORD ,

7.verse: Then the earth shook and trembled;

8.verse: There went up a smoke out of his nostrils,

9.verse: He bowed the heavens also, and came down:

10.verse: And he rode upon a cherub, and did fly:

11.verse: He made darkness his secret place; his pavilion round about him

12.verse: At the brightness that was before him his thick clouds passed,

13.verse: The LORD also thundered in the heavens, and the Highest gave his voice;

14.verse: Yea, he sent out his arrows, and scattered them;

15.verse: Then the channels of waters were seen, and the foundations of the world were discovered at thy rebuke, O LORD ,

16.verse: He sent from above, he took me,

17.verse: He delivered me from my strong enemy, and from them which hated me:

18.verse: They prevented me in the day of my calamity:

19.verse: He brought me forth also into a large place;

20.verse: The LORD rewarded me according to my righteousness;

21.verse: For I have kept the ways of the LORD ,

22.verse: For all his judgments were before me,

23.verse: I was also upright before him,

24.verse: Therefore hath the LORD recompensed me according to my righteousness,

25.verse: With the merciful thou wilt shew thyself merciful;

26.verse: With the pure thou wilt shew thyself pure;

27.verse: For thou wilt save the afflicted people;

28.verse: For thou wilt light my candle:

29.verse: For by thee I have run through a troop;

30.verse: As for God, his way is perfect:

31.verse: For who is God save the LORD ?

32.verse: It is God that girdeth me with strength,

33.verse: He maketh my feet like hinds' feet ,

34.verse: He teacheth my hands to war,

35.verse: Thou hast also given me the shield of thy salvation:

36.verse: Thou hast enlarged my steps under me,

37.verse: I have pursued mine enemies, and overtaken them:

38.verse: I have wounded them that they were not able to rise:

39.verse: For thou hast girded me with strength unto the battle:

40.verse: Thou hast also given me the necks of mine enemies;

41.verse: They cried, but there was none to save them:

42.verse: Then did I beat them small as the dust before the wind:

43.verse: Thou hast delivered me from the strivings of the people;

44.verse: As soon as they hear of me, they shall obey me:

46.verse: The LORD liveth; and blessed be my rock;

47.verse: It is God that avengeth me,

48.verse: He delivereth me from mine enemies: Yea, thou liftest me up above those that rise up against me:

49.verse: Therefore will I give thanks unto thee, O LORD , among the heathen,

50.verse: Great deliverance giveth he to his king;

1.verse: The heavens declare the glory of God;

2.verse: Day unto day uttereth speech,

3.verse: There is no speech nor language,

4.verse: Their line is gone out through all the earth,

5.verse: Which is as a bridegroom coming out of his chamber, and rejoiceth as a strong man to run a race.

6.verse: His going forth is from the end of the heaven, and his circuit unto the ends of it:

7.verse: The law of the LORD  is perfect, converting the soul:

8.verse: The statutes of the LORD  are right, rejoicing the heart:

9.verse: The fear of the LORD  is clean, enduring for ever:

10.verse: More to be desired are they than gold, yea, than much fine gold:

11.verse: Moreover by them is thy servant warned:

12.verse: Who can understand his errors?

13.verse: Keep back thy servant also from presumptuous sins ; Let them not have dominion over me:

14.verse: Let the words of my mouth, and the meditation of my heart, be acceptable in thy sight,

1.verse: The LORD hear thee in the day of trouble;

2.verse: Send thee help from the sanctuary,

3.verse: Remember all thy offerings,

4.verse: Grant thee according to thine own heart,

5.verse: We will rejoice in thy salvation, and in the name of our God we will set up our banners:

6.verse: Now know I that the LORD saveth his anointed; He will hear him from his holy heaven

7.verse: Some trust in chariots, and some in horses:

8.verse: They are brought down and fallen:

9.verse: Save, LORD :

1.verse: The king shall joy in thy strength, O LORD ;

2.verse: Thou hast given him his heart's desire,

3.verse: For thou preventest him with the blessings of goodness:

4.verse: He asked life of thee, and thou gavest it him,

5.verse: His glory is great in thy salvation:

6.verse: For thou hast made him most blessed for ever:

7.verse: For the king trusteth in the LORD ,

8.verse: Thine hand shall find out all thine enemies:

9.verse: Thou shalt make them as a fiery oven in the time of thine anger:

10.verse: Their fruit shalt thou destroy from the earth,

11.verse: For they intended evil against thee:

12.verse: Therefore shalt thou make them turn their back,

13.verse: Be thou exalted, LORD , in thine own strength:

1.verse: My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me?

2.verse: O my God, I cry in the daytime, but thou hearest not;

3.verse: But thou art holy,

4.verse: Our fathers trusted in thee:

5.verse: They cried unto thee, and were delivered:

6.verse: But I am a worm, and no man;

7.verse: All they that see me laugh me to scorn:

8.verse: He trusted on the LORD  that he would deliver him:

9.verse: But thou art he that took me out of the womb:

10.verse: I was cast upon thee from the womb:

11.verse: Be not far from me; for trouble is near;

12.verse: Many bulls have compassed me:

13.verse: They gaped upon me with their mouths,

14.verse: I am poured out like water, and all my bones are out of joint:

15.verse: My strength is dried up like a potsherd; And my tongue cleaveth to my jaws;

16.verse: For dogs have compassed me:

17.verse: I may tell all my bones:

18.verse: They part my garments among them,

19.verse: But be not thou far from me, O LORD :

20.verse: Deliver my soul from the sword;

21.verse: Save me from the lion's mouth:

22.verse: I will declare thy name unto my brethren:

23.verse: Ye that fear the LORD , praise him;

24.verse: For he hath not despised nor abhorred the affliction of the afflicted;

25.verse: My praise shall be of thee in the great congregation:

26.verse: The meek shall eat and be satisfied:

27.verse: All the ends of the world shall remember and turn unto the LORD :

28.verse: For the kingdom is the LORD 's:

29.verse: All they that be fat upon earth shall eat and worship:

31.verse: They shall come, and shall declare his righteousness

1.verse: The LORD  is my shepherd; I shall not want.

2.verse: He maketh me to lie down in green pastures:

3.verse: He restoreth my soul:

4.verse: Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil:

5.verse: Thou preparest a table before me in the presence of mine enemies:

6.verse: Surely goodness and mercy shall follow me all the days of my life:

1.verse: The earth is the LORD 's, and the fulness thereof;

2.verse: For he hath founded it upon the seas,

3.verse: Who shall ascend into the hill of the LORD ?

4.verse: He that hath clean hands, and a pure heart;

5.verse: He shall receive the blessing from the LORD ,

6.verse: This is the generation of them that seek him,

7.verse: Lift up your heads, O ye gates;

8.verse: Who is this King of glory?

9.verse: Lift up your heads, O ye gates; even lift them up, ye everlasting doors;

10.verse: Who is this King of glory?

1.verse: Unto thee, O LORD , do I lift up my soul.

2.verse: O my God, I trust in thee:

3.verse: Yea, let none that wait on thee be ashamed:

4.verse: Shew me thy ways, O LORD ;

5.verse: Lead me in thy truth, and teach me:

6.verse: Remember, O LORD , thy tender mercies and thy lovingkindnesses;

7.verse: Remember not the sins of my youth, nor my transgressions:

8.verse: Good and upright is the LORD :

9.verse: The meek will he guide in judgment:

10.verse: All the paths of the LORD  are mercy and truth

11.verse: For thy name's sake, O LORD ,

12.verse: What man is he that feareth the LORD ?

13.verse: His soul shall dwell at ease;

14.verse: The secret of the LORD  is with them that fear him;

15.verse: Mine eyes are ever toward the LORD ;

16.verse: Turn thee unto me, and have mercy upon me;

17.verse: The troubles of my heart are enlarged:

18.verse: Look upon mine affliction and my pain;

19.verse: Consider mine enemies; for they are many;

20.verse: O keep my soul, and deliver me:

21.verse: Let integrity and uprightness preserve me;

22.verse: Redeem Israel, O God, out of all his troubles.

1.verse: Judge me, O LORD ; for I have walked in mine integrity:

2.verse: Examine me, O LORD , and prove me;

3.verse: For thy lovingkindness is before mine eyes:

4.verse: I have not sat with vain persons,

5.verse: I have hated the congregation of evil doers;

6.verse: I will wash mine hands in innocency:

7.verse: That I may publish with the voice of thanksgiving,

8.verse: LORD , I have loved the habitation of thy house,

9.verse: Gather not my soul with sinners,

10.verse: In whose hands is mischief,

11.verse: But as for me, I will walk in mine integrity:

12.verse: My foot standeth in an even place:

1.verse: The LORD  is my light and my salvation; whom shall I fear?

2.verse: When the wicked, even mine enemies and my foes, came upon me to eat up my flesh,

3.verse: Though an host should encamp against me, my heart shall not fear:

4.verse: One thing have I desired of the LORD , that will I seek after;

5.verse: For in the time of trouble he shall hide me in his pavilion:

6.verse: And now shall mine head be lifted up,

7.verse: Hear, O LORD , when I cry with my voice:

8.verse: When thou saidst , Seek ye my face; my heart said unto thee,

9.verse: Hide not thy face far from me;

10.verse: When my father and my mother forsake me,

11.verse: Teach me thy way, O LORD ,

12.verse: Deliver me not over unto the will of mine enemies:

13.verse: I had fainted ,

14.verse: Wait on the LORD :

1.verse: Unto thee will I cry, O LORD my rock; be not silent to me:

2.verse: Hear the voice of my supplications, when I cry unto thee,

3.verse: Draw me not away with the wicked, and with the workers of iniquity,

4.verse: Give them according to their deeds,

5.verse: Because they regard not the works of the LORD , nor the operation of his hands,

6.verse: Blessed be the LORD ,

7.verse: The LORD  is my strength and my shield; my heart trusted in him, and I am helped:

8.verse: The LORD  is their strength,

9.verse: Save thy people, and bless thine inheritance:

1.verse: Give unto the LORD , O ye mighty, give unto the LORD glory and strength.

2.verse: Give unto the LORD the glory due unto his name;

3.verse: The voice of the LORD  is upon the waters:

4.verse: The voice of the LORD  is powerful;

5.verse: The voice of the LORD breaketh the cedars;

6.verse: He maketh them also to skip like a calf;

7.verse: The voice of the LORD divideth the flames of fire.

8.verse: The voice of the LORD shaketh the wilderness; the LORD shaketh the wilderness of Kadesh.

9.verse: The voice of the LORD maketh the hinds to calve, and discovereth the forests:

10.verse: The LORD sitteth upon the flood;

11.verse: The LORD will give strength unto his people;

1.verse: I will extol thee, O LORD ; for thou hast lifted me up,

2.verse: O LORD my God,

3.verse: O LORD , thou hast brought up my soul from the grave:

4.verse: Sing unto the LORD , O ye saints of his,

5.verse: For his anger endureth but a moment; in his favour is life:

6.verse: And in my prosperity I said, I shall never be moved.

7.verse: LORD , by thy favour thou hast made my mountain to stand strong:

8.verse: I cried to thee, O LORD ;

9.verse: What profit is there in my blood,

10.verse: Hear, O LORD , and have mercy upon me:

11.verse: Thou hast turned for me my mourning into dancing:

12.verse: To the end that my glory may sing praise to thee, and not be silent.

1.verse: In thee, O LORD , do I put my trust;

2.verse: Bow down thine ear to me; deliver me speedily:

3.verse: For thou art my rock and my fortress;

4.verse: Pull me out of the net that they have laid privily for me:

5.verse: Into thine hand I commit my spirit:

6.verse: I have hated them that regard lying vanities:

7.verse: I will be glad and rejoice in thy mercy:

8.verse: And hast not shut me up into the hand of the enemy:

9.verse: Have mercy upon me, O LORD , for I am in trouble:

10.verse: For my life is spent with grief,

11.verse: I was a reproach among all mine enemies, but especially among my neighbours,

12.verse: I am forgotten as a dead man out of mind:

13.verse: For I have heard the slander of many:

14.verse: But I trusted in thee, O LORD :

15.verse: My times are in thy hand:

16.verse: Make thy face to shine upon thy servant:

17.verse: Let me not be ashamed, O LORD ; for I have called upon thee:

18.verse: Let the lying lips be put to silence;

19.verse: Oh how great is thy goodness, which thou hast laid up for them that fear thee;

20.verse: Thou shalt hide them in the secret of thy presence from the pride of man:

21.verse: Blessed be the LORD :

22.verse: For I said in my haste,

23.verse: O love the LORD , all ye his saints:

24.verse: Be of good courage, and he shall strengthen your heart,

1.verse: Blessed is he whose transgression is forgiven,

2.verse: Blessed is the man unto whom the LORD imputeth not iniquity,

3.verse: When I kept silence, my bones waxed old

4.verse: For day and night thy hand was heavy upon me:

5.verse: I acknowledged my sin unto thee,

6.verse: For this shall every one that is godly pray unto thee in a time when thou mayest be found:

7.verse: Thou art my hiding place; thou shalt preserve me from trouble;

8.verse: I will instruct thee and teach thee in the way which thou shalt go:

9.verse: Be ye not as the horse, or as the mule, which have no understanding:

10.verse: Many sorrows shall be to the wicked:

11.verse: Be glad in the LORD , and rejoice, ye righteous:

1.verse: Rejoice in the LORD , O ye righteous:

2.verse: Praise the LORD with harp:

3.verse: Sing unto him a new song;

4.verse: For the word of the LORD  is right;

5.verse: He loveth righteousness and judgment:

6.verse: By the word of the LORD were the heavens made;

7.verse: He gathereth the waters of the sea together as an heap:

8.verse: Let all the earth fear the LORD :

9.verse: For he spake, and it was done ;

10.verse: The LORD bringeth the counsel of the heathen to nought:

11.verse: The counsel of the LORD standeth for ever,

12.verse: Blessed is the nation whose God is the LORD ;

13.verse: The LORD looketh from heaven; he beholdeth all the sons of men.

14.verse: From the place of his habitation he looketh upon all the inhabitants of the earth.

15.verse: He fashioneth their hearts alike;

16.verse: There is no king saved by the multitude of an host:

17.verse: An horse is a vain thing for safety:

18.verse: Behold, the eye of the LORD  is upon them that fear him,

19.verse: To deliver their soul from death,

20.verse: Our soul waiteth for the LORD :

21.verse: For our heart shall rejoice in him,

22.verse: Let thy mercy, O LORD , be upon us,

1.verse: I will bless the LORD at all times:

2.verse: My soul shall make her boast in the LORD :

3.verse: O magnify the LORD with me,

4.verse: I sought the LORD , and he heard me,

5.verse: They looked unto him, and were lightened:

6.verse: This poor man cried, and the LORD heard him ,

7.verse: The angel of the LORD encampeth round about them that fear him,

8.verse: O taste and see that the LORD  is good:

9.verse: O fear the LORD , ye his saints:

10.verse: The young lions do lack, and suffer hunger:

11.verse: Come, ye children, hearken unto me:

12.verse: What man is he that desireth life,

13.verse: Keep thy tongue from evil,

14.verse: Depart from evil, and do good;

15.verse: The eyes of the LORD  are upon the righteous,

16.verse: The face of the LORD  is against them that do evil,

17.verse: The righteous cry, and the LORD heareth,

18.verse: The LORD  is nigh unto them that are of a broken heart;

19.verse: Many are the afflictions of the righteous:

20.verse: He keepeth all his bones:

21.verse: Evil shall slay the wicked:

22.verse: The LORD redeemeth the soul of his servants:

1.verse: Plead my cause , O LORD , with them that strive with me:

2.verse: Take hold of shield and buckler,

3.verse: Draw out also the spear, and stop the way against them that persecute me:

4.verse: Let them be confounded and put to shame that seek after my soul:

5.verse: Let them be as chaff before the wind:

6.verse: Let their way be dark and slippery:

7.verse: For without cause have they hid for me their net in a pit,

8.verse: Let destruction come upon him at unawares; and let his net that he hath hid catch himself:

9.verse: And my soul shall be joyful in the LORD :

10.verse: All my bones shall say, LORD , who is like unto thee, which deliverest the poor from him that is too strong for him,

11.verse: False witnesses did rise up;

12.verse: They rewarded me evil for good

13.verse: But as for me, when they were sick, my clothing was sackcloth: I humbled my soul with fasting;

14.verse: I behaved myself as though he had been my friend or brother:

15.verse: But in mine adversity they rejoiced, and gathered themselves together:

16.verse: With hypocritical mockers in feasts,

17.verse: Lord, how long wilt thou look on?

18.verse: I will give thee thanks in the great congregation:

19.verse: Let not them that are mine enemies wrongfully rejoice over me:

20.verse: For they speak not peace:

21.verse: Yea, they opened their mouth wide against me,

22.verse: This thou hast seen, O LORD : keep not silence:

23.verse: Stir up thyself, and awake to my judgment,

24.verse: Judge me, O LORD my God, according to thy righteousness;

25.verse: Let them not say in their hearts, Ah, so would we have it:

26.verse: Let them be ashamed and brought to confusion together that rejoice at mine hurt:

27.verse: Let them shout for joy, and be glad, that favour my righteous cause:

28.verse: And my tongue shall speak of thy righteousness

1.verse: The transgression of the wicked saith within my heart,

2.verse: For he flattereth himself in his own eyes, until his iniquity be found to be hateful.

3.verse: The words of his mouth are iniquity and deceit:

4.verse: He deviseth mischief upon his bed;

5.verse: Thy mercy, O LORD , is in the heavens;

6.verse: Thy righteousness is like the great mountains;

7.verse: How excellent is thy lovingkindness, O God!

8.verse: They shall be abundantly satisfied with the fatness of thy house;

9.verse: For with thee is the fountain of life:

10.verse: O continue thy lovingkindness unto them that know thee;

11.verse: Let not the foot of pride come against me,

12.verse: There are the workers of iniquity fallen:

1.verse: Fret not thyself because of evildoers,

2.verse: For they shall soon be cut down like the grass,

3.verse: Trust in the LORD , and do good;

4.verse: Delight thyself also in the LORD ;

5.verse: Commit thy way unto the LORD ; Trust also in him;

6.verse: And he shall bring forth thy righteousness as the light,

7.verse: Rest in the LORD , and wait patiently for him:

8.verse: Cease from anger, and forsake wrath:

9.verse: For evildoers shall be cut off:

10.verse: For yet a little while, and the wicked shall not be:

11.verse: But the meek shall inherit the earth;

12.verse: The wicked plotteth against the just,

13.verse: The Lord shall laugh at him:

14.verse: The wicked have drawn out the sword, and have bent their bow,

15.verse: Their sword shall enter into their own heart,

16.verse: A little that a righteous man hath is better

17.verse: For the arms of the wicked shall be broken:

18.verse: The LORD knoweth the days of the upright:

19.verse: They shall not be ashamed in the evil time:

20.verse: But the wicked shall perish,

21.verse: The wicked borroweth, and payeth not again:

22.verse: For such as be blessed of him shall inherit the earth;

23.verse: The steps of a good man are ordered by the LORD :

24.verse: Though he fall, he shall not be utterly cast down:

25.verse: I have been young, and now am old;

26.verse: He is ever merciful, and lendeth;

27.verse: Depart from evil, and do good;

29.verse: The righteous shall inherit the land,

30.verse: The mouth of the righteous speaketh wisdom,

31.verse: The law of his God is in his heart;

33.verse: The LORD will not leave him in his hand,

34.verse: Wait on the LORD , and keep his way, and he shall exalt thee to inherit the land:

35.verse: I have seen the wicked in great power,

36.verse: Yet he passed away, and, lo, he was not:

37.verse: Mark the perfect man , and behold the upright:

38.verse: But the transgressors shall be destroyed together:

39.verse: But the salvation of the righteous is of the LORD :

40.verse: And the LORD shall help them, and deliver them:

1.verse: O LORD , rebuke me not in thy wrath:

2.verse: For thine arrows stick fast in me,

3.verse: There is no soundness in my flesh because of thine anger;

4.verse: For mine iniquities are gone over mine head:

5.verse: My wounds stink and are corrupt

6.verse: I am troubled; I am bowed down greatly;

7.verse: For my loins are filled with a loathsome disease:

8.verse: I am feeble and sore broken:

9.verse: Lord, all my desire is before thee;

10.verse: My heart panteth, my strength faileth me:

11.verse: My lovers and my friends stand aloof from my sore;

12.verse: They also that seek after my life lay snares for me:

13.verse: But I, as a deaf man , heard not;

14.verse: Thus I was as a man that heareth not,

15.verse: For in thee, O LORD , do I hope:

16.verse: For I said, Hear me , lest otherwise they should rejoice over me:

17.verse: For I am ready to halt,

18.verse: For I will declare mine iniquity;

19.verse: But mine enemies are lively, and they are strong:

20.verse: They also that render evil for good

21.verse: Forsake me not, O LORD :

22.verse: Make haste to help me,

1.verse: I said, I will take heed to my ways,

2.verse: I was dumb with silence, I held my peace, even from good;

3.verse: My heart was hot within me, while I was musing the fire burned:

4.verse: LORD , make me to know mine end, and the measure of my days, what it is ;

5.verse: Behold, thou hast made my days as an handbreadth;

6.verse: Surely every man walketh in a vain shew: Surely they are disquieted in vain:

7.verse: And now, Lord, what wait I for?

8.verse: Deliver me from all my transgressions:

9.verse: I was dumb, I opened not my mouth;

10.verse: Remove thy stroke away from me:

11.verse: When thou with rebukes dost correct man for iniquity,

12.verse: Hear my prayer, O LORD , and give ear unto my cry;

13.verse: O spare me, that I may recover strength,

1.verse: I waited patiently for the LORD ;

2.verse: He brought me up also out of an horrible pit, out of the miry clay,

3.verse: And he hath put a new song in my mouth, even

4.verse: Blessed is that man that maketh the LORD his trust,

5.verse: Many, O LORD my God,

6.verse: Sacrifice and offering thou didst not desire;

7.verse: Then said I, Lo, I come:

8.verse: I delight to do thy will, O my God:

9.verse: I have preached righteousness in the great congregation:

10.verse: I have not hid thy righteousness within my heart;

11.verse: Withhold not thou thy tender mercies from me, O LORD :

12.verse: For innumerable evils have compassed me about:

13.verse: Be pleased, O LORD , to deliver me:

14.verse: Let them be ashamed and confounded together

15.verse: Let them be desolate for a reward of their shame

16.verse: Let all those that seek thee rejoice and be glad in thee:

17.verse: But I am poor and needy; Yet the Lord thinketh upon me:

1.verse: Blessed is he that considereth the poor:

2.verse: The LORD will preserve him, and keep him alive; and he shall be blessed upon the earth:

3.verse: The LORD will strengthen him upon the bed of languishing:

4.verse: I said, LORD , be merciful unto me:

5.verse: Mine enemies speak evil of me,

6.verse: And if he come to see me , he speaketh vanity:

7.verse: All that hate me whisper together against me:

8.verse: An evil disease, say they , cleaveth fast unto him:

9.verse: Yea, mine own familiar friend, in whom I trusted,

10.verse: But thou, O LORD , be merciful unto me,

11.verse: By this I know that thou favourest me,

12.verse: And as for me, thou upholdest me in mine integrity,

13.verse: Blessed be the LORD God of Israel

1.verse: As the hart panteth after the water brooks,

2.verse: My soul thirsteth for God, for the living God:

3.verse: My tears have been my meat day and night,

4.verse: When I remember these things , I pour out my soul in me:

5.verse: Why art thou cast down, O my soul?

6.verse: O my God, my soul is cast down within me:

7.verse: Deep calleth unto deep at the noise of thy waterspouts:

8.verse: Yet the LORD will command his lovingkindness in the daytime,

9.verse: I will say unto God my rock, why hast thou forgotten me?

10.verse: As with a sword in my bones,

11.verse: Why art thou cast down, O my soul?

1.verse: Judge me, O God, and plead my cause against an ungodly nation:

2.verse: For thou art the God of my strength: why dost thou cast me off?

3.verse: O send out thy light and thy truth: Let them lead me;

4.verse: Then will I go unto the altar of God, unto God my exceeding joy:

5.verse: Why art thou cast down, O my soul?

1.verse: We have heard with our ears, O God, our fathers have told us,

2.verse: How thou didst drive out the heathen with thy hand, and plantedst them;

3.verse: For they got not the land in possession by their own sword,

4.verse: Thou art my King, O God: Command deliverances for Jacob.

5.verse: Through thee will we push down our enemies:

6.verse: For I will not trust in my bow,

7.verse: But thou hast saved us from our enemies,

8.verse: In God we boast all the day long,

9.verse: But thou hast cast off, and put us to shame;

10.verse: Thou makest us to turn back from the enemy:

11.verse: Thou hast given us like sheep appointed for meat;

12.verse: Thou sellest thy people for nought,

13.verse: Thou makest us a reproach to our neighbours,

14.verse: Thou makest us a byword among the heathen,

15.verse: My confusion is continually before me,

16.verse: For the voice of him that reproacheth and blasphemeth;

17.verse: All this is come upon us; yet have we not forgotten thee,

18.verse: Our heart is not turned back,

19.verse: Though thou hast sore broken us in the place of dragons,

20.verse: If we have forgotten the name of our God, or stretched out our hands to a strange god;

21.verse: Shall not God search this out? For he knoweth the secrets of the heart.

22.verse: Yea, for thy sake are we killed all the day long;

23.verse: Awake, why sleepest thou, O Lord?

24.verse: Wherefore hidest thou thy face,

25.verse: For our soul is bowed down to the dust:

1.verse: My heart is inditing a good matter:

2.verse: Thou art fairer than the children of men:

3.verse: Gird thy sword upon thy thigh, O most mighty,

4.verse: And in thy majesty ride prosperously

5.verse: Thine arrows are sharp in the heart of the king's enemies;

6.verse: Thy throne, O God, is for ever and ever:

7.verse: Thou lovest righteousness, and hatest wickedness:

8.verse: All thy garments smell of myrrh, and aloes, and cassia,

9.verse: Kings' daughters were among thy honourable women:

10.verse: Hearken, O daughter, and consider, and incline thine ear;

11.verse: So shall the king greatly desire thy beauty:

12.verse: And the daughter of Tyre shall be there with a gift;

13.verse: The king's daughter is all glorious within:

14.verse: She shall be brought unto the king in raiment of needlework:

15.verse: With gladness and rejoicing shall they be brought:

16.verse: Instead of thy fathers shall be thy children,

17.verse: I will make thy name to be remembered in all generations:

1.verse: God is our refuge and strength,

2.verse: Therefore will not we fear, though the earth be removed,

3.verse: Though the waters thereof roar and be troubled,

4.verse: There is a river, the streams whereof shall make glad the city of God,

5.verse: God is in the midst of her; she shall not be moved:

6.verse: The heathen raged, the kingdoms were moved:

7.verse: The LORD of hosts is with us;

8.verse: Come, behold the works of the LORD ,

9.verse: He maketh wars to cease unto the end of the earth;

10.verse: Be still, and know that I am God:

11.verse: The LORD of hosts is with us;

1.verse: O clap your hands, all ye people;

2.verse: For the LORD most high is terrible;

3.verse: He shall subdue the people under us,

4.verse: He shall choose our inheritance for us,

5.verse: God is gone up with a shout,

6.verse: Sing praises to God, sing praises:

7.verse: For God is the King of all the earth:

8.verse: God reigneth over the heathen:

9.verse: The princes of the people are gathered together, even the people of the God of Abraham:

1.verse: Great is the LORD , and greatly to be praised

2.verse: Beautiful for situation, the joy of the whole earth,

3.verse: God is known in her palaces for a refuge.

4.verse: For, lo, the kings were assembled,

5.verse: They saw it, and so they marvelled;

6.verse: Fear took hold upon them there,

7.verse: Thou breakest the ships of Tarshish

8.verse: As we have heard, so have we seen in the city of the LORD of hosts, in the city of our God:

9.verse: We have thought of thy lovingkindness, O God,

10.verse: According to thy name, O God, so is thy praise unto the ends of the earth:

11.verse: Let mount Zion rejoice,

12.verse: Walk about Zion, and go round about her:

13.verse: Mark ye well her bulwarks, consider her palaces;

14.verse: For this God is our God for ever and ever:

1.verse: Hear this, all ye people;

2.verse: Both low and high,

3.verse: My mouth shall speak of wisdom;

4.verse: I will incline mine ear to a parable:

5.verse: Wherefore should I fear in the days of evil,

6.verse: They that trust in their wealth,

7.verse: None of them can by any means redeem his brother,

8.verse: (For the redemption of their soul is precious,

9.verse: That he should still live for ever,

10.verse: For he seeth that wise men die,

11.verse: Their inward thought is, that their houses shall continue for ever,

12.verse: Nevertheless man being in honour abideth not:

13.verse: This their way is their folly:

14.verse: Like sheep they are laid in the grave; Death shall feed on them; And the upright shall have dominion over them in the morning;

15.verse: But God will redeem my soul from the power of the grave:

16.verse: Be not thou afraid when one is made rich,

17.verse: For when he dieth he shall carry nothing away:

18.verse: Though while he lived he blessed his soul,

19.verse: He shall go to the generation of his fathers;

20.verse: Man that is in honour, and understandeth not,

1.verse: The mighty God, even the LORD , hath spoken,

2.verse: Out of Zion, the perfection of beauty,

3.verse: Our God shall come, and shall not keep silence:

4.verse: He shall call to the heavens from above,

5.verse: Gather my saints together unto me;

6.verse: And the heavens shall declare his righteousness:

7.verse: Hear, O my people, and I will speak;

8.verse: I will not reprove thee for thy sacrifices

9.verse: I will take no bullock out of thy house,

10.verse: For every beast of the forest is mine,

11.verse: I know all the fowls of the mountains:

12.verse: If I were hungry, I would not tell thee:

13.verse: Will I eat the flesh of bulls,

14.verse: Offer unto God thanksgiving;

15.verse: And call upon me in the day of trouble:

16.verse: But unto the wicked God saith,

17.verse: Seeing thou hatest instruction,

18.verse: When thou sawest a thief, then thou consentedst with him,

19.verse: Thou givest thy mouth to evil,

20.verse: Thou sittest and speakest against thy brother;

21.verse: These things hast thou done, and I kept silence;

22.verse: Now consider this, ye that forget God,

23.verse: Whoso offereth praise glorifieth me:

1.verse: Have mercy upon me, O God, according to thy lovingkindness:

2.verse: Wash me throughly from mine iniquity,

3.verse: For I acknowledge my transgressions:

4.verse: Against thee, thee only, have I sinned, and done this evil in thy sight:

5.verse: Behold, I was shapen in iniquity;

6.verse: Behold, thou desirest truth in the inward parts:

7.verse: Purge me with hyssop, and I shall be clean:

8.verse: Make me to hear joy and gladness;

9.verse: Hide thy face from my sins,

10.verse: Create in me a clean heart, O God;

11.verse: Cast me not away from thy presence;

12.verse: Restore unto me the joy of thy salvation;

13.verse: Then will I teach transgressors thy ways;

14.verse: Deliver me from bloodguiltiness, O God, thou God of my salvation:

15.verse: O Lord, open thou my lips;

16.verse: For thou desirest not sacrifice; else would I give it:

17.verse: The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit:

18.verse: Do good in thy good pleasure unto Zion:

19.verse: Then shalt thou be pleased with the sacrifices of righteousness, with burnt offering and whole burnt offering:

1.verse: Why boastest thou thyself in mischief, O mighty man?

2.verse: Thy tongue deviseth mischiefs;

3.verse: Thou lovest evil more than good;

4.verse: Thou lovest all devouring words,

5.verse: God shall likewise destroy thee for ever,

6.verse: The righteous also shall see, and fear,

7.verse: Lo, this is the man that made not God his strength;

8.verse: But I am like a green olive tree in the house of God:

9.verse: I will praise thee for ever, because thou hast done it:

1.verse: The fool hath said in his heart,

2.verse: God looked down from heaven upon the children of men,

3.verse: Every one of them is gone back: they are altogether become filthy;

4.verse: Have the workers of iniquity no knowledge?

5.verse: There were they in great fear, where no fear was:

6.verse: Oh that the salvation of Israel were come out of Zion!

1.verse: Save me, O God, by thy name,

2.verse: Hear my prayer, O God;

3.verse: For strangers are risen up against me,

4.verse: Behold, God is mine helper:

5.verse: He shall reward evil unto mine enemies:

6.verse: I will freely sacrifice unto thee:

7.verse: For he hath delivered me out of all trouble:

1.verse: Give ear to my prayer, O God;

2.verse: Attend unto me, and hear me:

3.verse: Because of the voice of the enemy,

4.verse: My heart is sore pained within me:

5.verse: Fearfulness and trembling are come upon me,

6.verse: And I said, Oh that I had wings like a dove!

7.verse: Lo, then would I wander far off,

8.verse: I would hasten my escape

9.verse: Destroy, O Lord, and divide their tongues:

10.verse: Day and night they go about it upon the walls thereof:

11.verse: Wickedness is in the midst thereof:

12.verse: For it was not an enemy that reproached me;

13.verse: But it was thou, a man mine equal,

14.verse: We took sweet counsel together,

15.verse: Let death seize upon them, and let them go down quick into hell:

16.verse: As for me, I will call upon God;

17.verse: Evening, and morning, and at noon, will I pray, and cry aloud:

18.verse: He hath delivered my soul in peace from the battle that was against me:

19.verse: God shall hear, and afflict them, even he that abideth of old. Selah.

20.verse: He hath put forth his hands against such as be at peace with him:

21.verse: The words of his mouth were smoother than butter, but war was in his heart:

22.verse: Cast thy burden upon the LORD , and he shall sustain thee:

23.verse: But thou,

1.verse: Be merciful unto me, O God: for man would swallow me up;

2.verse: Mine enemies would daily swallow me up:

3.verse: What time I am afraid,

4.verse: In God I will praise his word,

5.verse: Every day they wrest my words:

6.verse: They gather themselves together, they hide themselves,

7.verse: Shall they escape by iniquity?

8.verse: Thou tellest my wanderings: Put thou my tears into thy bottle:

9.verse: When I cry unto thee , then shall mine enemies turn back:

10.verse: In God will I praise his word:

11.verse: In God have I put my trust:

12.verse: Thy vows are upon me, O God:

13.verse: For thou hast delivered my soul from death: wilt not thou deliver my feet from falling,

1.verse: Be merciful unto me, O God, be merciful unto me: For my soul trusteth in thee:

2.verse: I will cry unto God most high;

3.verse: He shall send from heaven, and save me

4.verse: My soul is among lions:

5.verse: Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens;

6.verse: They have prepared a net for my steps; My soul is bowed down:

7.verse: My heart is fixed, O God, my heart is fixed:

8.verse: Awake up, my glory; awake, psaltery and harp:

9.verse: I will praise thee, O Lord, among the people:

10.verse: For thy mercy is great unto the heavens,

11.verse: Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens:

1.verse: Do ye indeed speak righteousness, O congregation?

2.verse: Yea, in heart ye work wickedness;

3.verse: The wicked are estranged from the womb:

4.verse: Their poison is like the poison of a serpent:

5.verse: Which will not hearken to the voice of charmers,

6.verse: Break their teeth, O God, in their mouth: Break out the great teeth of the young lions, O LORD .

7.verse: Let them melt away as waters which run continually: when he bendeth his bow to shoot his arrows, let them be as cut in pieces.

8.verse: As a snail which melteth, let every one of them pass away: Like the untimely birth of a woman,

9.verse: Before your pots can feel the thorns,

10.verse: The righteous shall rejoice when he seeth the vengeance:

11.verse: So that a man shall say, Verily there is a reward for the righteous:

1.verse: Deliver me from mine enemies, O my God:

2.verse: Deliver me from the workers of iniquity,

3.verse: For, lo, they lie in wait for my soul:

4.verse: They run and prepare themselves without my fault.

5.verse: Thou therefore, O LORD God of hosts, the God of Israel,

6.verse: They return at evening:

7.verse: Behold, they belch out with their mouth: Swords are in their lips:

8.verse: But thou, O LORD , shalt laugh at them;

9.verse: Because of his strength will I wait upon thee:

10.verse: The God of my mercy shall prevent me:

11.verse: Slay them not, lest my people forget:

12.verse: For the sin of their mouth and the words of their lips let them even be taken in their pride:

13.verse: Consume them in wrath, consume them , that they may not be:

14.verse: And at evening let them return;

15.verse: Let them wander up and down for meat,

16.verse: But I will sing of thy power; Yea, I will sing aloud of thy mercy in the morning:

17.verse: Unto thee, O my strength, will I sing:

1.verse: O God, thou hast cast us off, thou has scattered us,

2.verse: Thou hast made the earth to tremble; thou hast broken it:

3.verse: Thou hast shewed thy people hard things:

4.verse: Thou hast given a banner to them that fear thee,

5.verse: That thy beloved may be delivered;

6.verse: God hath spoken in his holiness; I will rejoice, I will divide Shechem,

7.verse: Gilead is mine, and Manasseh is mine;

8.verse: Moab is my washpot; Over Edom will I cast out my shoe:

9.verse: Who will bring me into the strong city?

10.verse: Wilt not thou, O God, which hadst cast us off?

11.verse: Give us help from trouble:

12.verse: Through God we shall do valiantly:

1.verse: Hear my cry, O God;

2.verse: From the end of the earth will I cry unto thee,

3.verse: For thou hast been a shelter for me, and a strong tower from the enemy.

4.verse: I will abide in thy tabernacle for ever:

5.verse: For thou, O God, hast heard my vows:

6.verse: Thou wilt prolong the king's life:

7.verse: He shall abide before God for ever:

8.verse: So will I sing praise unto thy name for ever,

1.verse: Truly my soul waiteth upon God:

2.verse: He only is my rock and my salvation;

3.verse: How long will ye imagine mischief against a man?

4.verse: They only consult to cast him down from his excellency:

5.verse: My soul, wait thou only upon God;

6.verse: He only is my rock and my salvation:

7.verse: In God is my salvation and my glory:

8.verse: Trust in him at all times; ye people,

9.verse: Surely men of low degree are vanity,

10.verse: Trust not in oppression, and become not vain in robbery:

11.verse: God hath spoken once; Twice have I heard this;

12.verse: Also unto thee, O Lord, belongeth mercy:

1.verse: O God, thou art

2.verse: To see thy power and thy glory,

3.verse: Because thy lovingkindness

4.verse: Thus will I bless thee while I live: I will lift up my hands in thy name.

5.verse: My soul shall be satisfied as with marrow and fatness;

6.verse: When I remember thee upon my bed,

7.verse: Because thou hast been my help,

8.verse: My soul followeth hard after thee:

9.verse: But those that seek my soul, to destroy it ,

10.verse: They shall fall by the sword:

11.verse: But the king shall rejoice in God; Every one that sweareth by him shall glory:

1.verse: Hear my voice, O God, in my prayer:

2.verse: Hide me from the secret counsel of the wicked;

3.verse: Who whet their tongue like a sword,

4.verse: That they may shoot in secret at the perfect:

5.verse: They encourage themselves in an evil matter:

6.verse: They search out iniquities; they accomplish a diligent search:

7.verse: But God shall shoot at them

8.verse: So they shall make their own tongue to fall upon themselves:

9.verse: And all men shall fear, and shall declare the work of God;

10.verse: The righteous shall be glad in the LORD , and shall trust in him;

1.verse: Praise waiteth for thee, O God, in Zion:

2.verse: O thou that hearest prayer,

3.verse: Iniquities prevail against me:

4.verse: Blessed is the man whom thou choosest, and causest to approach unto thee ,

5.verse: By terrible things in righteousness wilt thou answer us, O God of our salvation;

6.verse: Which by his strength setteth fast the mountains;

7.verse: Which stilleth the noise of the seas,

8.verse: They also that dwell in the uttermost parts are afraid at thy tokens:

9.verse: Thou visitest the earth, and waterest it:

10.verse: Thou waterest the ridges thereof abundantly: Thou settlest the furrows thereof:

11.verse: Thou crownest the year with thy goodness;

12.verse: They drop upon the pastures of the wilderness:

13.verse: The pastures are clothed with flocks;

1.verse: Make a joyful noise unto God, all ye lands:

2.verse: Sing forth the honour of his name: Make his praise glorious.

3.verse: Say unto God, How terrible art thou in thy works!

4.verse: All the earth shall worship thee,

5.verse: Come and see the works of God:

6.verse: He turned the sea into dry land:

7.verse: He ruleth by his power for ever; His eyes behold the nations:

8.verse: O bless our God, ye people,

9.verse: Which holdeth our soul in life,

10.verse: For thou, O God, hast proved us:

11.verse: Thou broughtest us into the net;

12.verse: Thou hast caused men to ride over our heads;

13.verse: I will go into thy house with burnt offerings:

14.verse: which my lips have uttered, and my mouth hath spoken, when I was in trouble.

15.verse: I will offer unto thee burnt sacrifices of fatlings, with the incense of rams;

16.verse: Come and hear, all ye that fear God,

17.verse: I cried unto him with my mouth,

18.verse: If I regard iniquity in my heart,

19.verse: But verily God hath heard me ;

20.verse: Blessed be God, which hath not turned away my prayer,

1.verse: God be merciful unto us, and bless us;

2.verse: That thy way may be known upon earth,

3.verse: Let the people praise thee, O God;

4.verse: O let the nations be glad and sing for joy:

5.verse: Let the people praise thee, O God;

6.verse: Then shall the earth yield her increase;

7.verse: God shall bless us;

1.verse: Let God arise, let his enemies be scattered:

2.verse: As smoke is driven away, so drive them away:

3.verse: But let the righteous be glad; let them rejoice before God:

4.verse: Sing unto God,

5.verse: A father of the fatherless, and a judge of the widows,

6.verse: God setteth the solitary in families: He bringeth out those which are bound with chains:

7.verse: O God, when thou wentest forth before thy people,

8.verse: The earth shook, the heavens also dropped at the presence of God:

9.verse: Thou, O God, didst send a plentiful rain, whereby thou didst confirm thine inheritance,

10.verse: Thy congregation hath dwelt therein:

11.verse: The Lord gave the word:

12.verse: Kings of armies did flee apace:

13.verse: Though ye have lien among the pots, yet shall ye be as the wings of a dove

14.verse: When the Almighty scattered kings in it,

15.verse: The hill of God is as the hill of Bashan;

16.verse: Why leap ye, ye high hills? This is the hill which God desireth to dwell in;

17.verse: The chariots of God are twenty thousand, even thousands of angels:

18.verse: Thou hast ascended on high, thou hast led captivity captive: Thou hast received gifts for men;

19.verse: Blessed be the Lord,

20.verse: He that is our God is the God of salvation;

21.verse: But God shall wound the head of his enemies,

22.verse: The Lord said, I will bring again from Bashan, I will bring my people again

23.verse: That thy foot may be dipped in the blood of thine enemies,

24.verse: They have seen thy goings, O God;

25.verse: The singers went before, the players on instruments followed after;

26.verse: Bless ye God in the congregations,

27.verse: There is little Benjamin with their ruler, the princes of Judah and their council,

28.verse: Thy God hath commanded thy strength:

29.verse: Because of thy temple at Jerusalem

31.verse: Princes shall come out of Egypt;

32.verse: Sing unto God, ye kingdoms of the earth;

33.verse: To him that rideth upon the heavens of heavens, which were of old;

34.verse: Ascribe ye strength unto God: His excellency is over Israel,

35.verse: O God, thou art terrible out of thy holy places:

1.verse: Save me, O God;

2.verse: I sink in deep mire, where there is no standing:

3.verse: I am weary of my crying: my throat is dried:

4.verse: They that hate me without a cause are more than the hairs of mine head:

5.verse: O God, thou knowest my foolishness; And my sins are not hid from thee.

6.verse: Let not them that wait on thee, O Lord GOD of hosts, be ashamed for my sake:

7.verse: Because for thy sake I have borne reproach;

8.verse: I am become a stranger unto my brethren,

9.verse: For the zeal of thine house hath eaten me up;

10.verse: When I wept, and chastened my soul with fasting,

11.verse: I made sackcloth also my garment;

12.verse: They that sit in the gate speak against me;

13.verse: But as for me, my prayer

14.verse: Deliver me out of the mire, and let me not sink:

15.verse: Let not the waterflood overflow me, neither let the deep swallow me up,

16.verse: Hear me, O LORD ; for thy lovingkindness is good:

17.verse: And hide not thy face from thy servant; For I am in trouble:

18.verse: Draw nigh unto my soul, and redeem it:

19.verse: Thou hast known my reproach, and my shame, and my dishonour:

20.verse: Reproach hath broken my heart; and I am full of heaviness:

21.verse: They gave me also gall for my meat;

22.verse: Let their table become a snare before them:

23.verse: Let their eyes be darkened, that they see not;

24.verse: Pour out thine indignation upon them,

26.verse: For they persecute him whom thou hast smitten;

28.verse: Let them be blotted out of the book of the living,

29.verse: But I am poor and sorrowful:

30.verse: I will praise the name of God with a song,

31.verse: This also shall please the LORD

32.verse: The humble shall see this, and be glad:

33.verse: For the LORD heareth the poor,

34.verse: Let the heaven and earth praise him,

35.verse: For God will save Zion, and will build the cities of Judah:

36.verse: The seed also of his servants shall inherit it:

1.verse: Make haste , O God, to deliver me;

2.verse: Let them be ashamed and confounded that seek after my soul:

3.verse: Let them be turned back for a reward of their shame

4.verse: Let all those that seek thee rejoice and be glad in thee:

5.verse: But I am poor and needy;

1.verse: In thee, O LORD , do I put my trust: Let me never be put to confusion.

2.verse: Deliver me in thy righteousness, and cause me to escape: Incline thine ear unto me, and save me.

3.verse: Be thou my strong habitation, whereunto I may continually resort:

4.verse: Deliver me, O my God, out of the hand of the wicked,

5.verse: For thou art my hope, O Lord GOD :

6.verse: By thee have I been holden up from the womb:

7.verse: I am as a wonder unto many;

8.verse: Let my mouth be filled with thy praise

9.verse: Cast me not off in the time of old age;

10.verse: For mine enemies speak against me;

11.verse: saying,

12.verse: O God, be not far from me:

13.verse: Let them be confounded and consumed that are adversaries to my soul;

14.verse: But I will hope continually,

15.verse: My mouth shall shew forth thy righteousness and thy salvation all the day;

16.verse: I will go in the strength of the Lord GOD :

17.verse: O God, thou hast taught me from my youth:

18.verse: Now also when I am old and greyheaded, O God, forsake me not;

19.verse: Thy righteousness also, O God, is very high,

20.verse: Thou , which hast shewed me great and sore troubles, shalt quicken me again,

21.verse: Thou shalt increase my greatness,

22.verse: I will also praise thee with the psaltery, even thy truth, O my God:

23.verse: My lips shall greatly rejoice when I sing unto thee;

24.verse: My tongue also shall talk of thy righteousness all the day long:

1.verse: Give the king thy judgments, O God,

2.verse: He shall judge thy people with righteousness,

3.verse: The mountains shall bring peace to the people,

4.verse: He shall judge the poor of the people,

5.verse: They shall fear thee as long as the sun and moon endure,

6.verse: He shall come down like rain upon the mown grass:

7.verse: In his days shall the righteous flourish;

8.verse: He shall have dominion also from sea to sea,

9.verse: They that dwell in the wilderness shall bow before him;

10.verse: The kings of Tarshish and of the isles shall bring presents:

11.verse: Yea, all kings shall fall down before him:

12.verse: For he shall deliver the needy when he crieth;

13.verse: He shall spare the poor and needy,

14.verse: He shall redeem their soul from deceit and violence:

15.verse: And he shall live, and to him shall be given of the gold of Sheba:

16.verse: There shall be an handful of corn in the earth upon the top of the mountains;

17.verse: His name shall endure for ever:

18.verse: Blessed be the LORD God, the God of Israel,

19.verse: And blessed be his glorious name for ever:

20.verse: The prayers of David the son of Jesse are ended.

1.verse: Truly God is good to Israel,

2.verse: But as for me, my feet were almost gone;

3.verse: For I was envious at the foolish,

4.verse: For there are no bands in their death:

5.verse: They are not in trouble as other men;

6.verse: Therefore pride compasseth them about as a chain;

7.verse: Their eyes stand out with fatness:

8.verse: They are corrupt, and speak wickedly concerning oppression:

9.verse: They set their mouth against the heavens,

10.verse: Therefore his people return hither:

11.verse: And they say, How doth God know?

12.verse: Behold, these are the ungodly, who prosper in the world; they increase in riches.

13.verse: Verily I have cleansed my heart in vain, and washed my hands in innocency.

14.verse: For all the day long have I been plagued,

15.verse: If I say, I will speak thus;

16.verse: When I thought to know this,

17.verse: Until I went into the sanctuary of God;

18.verse: Surely thou didst set them in slippery places:

19.verse: How are they brought into desolation, as in a moment!

20.verse: As a dream when one awaketh;

21.verse: Thus my heart was grieved,

22.verse: So foolish was I, and ignorant:

23.verse: Nevertheless I am continually with thee:

24.verse: Thou shalt guide me with thy counsel,

25.verse: Whom have I in heaven but thee?

26.verse: My flesh and my heart faileth:

27.verse: For, lo, they that are far from thee shall perish:

28.verse: But it is good for me to draw near to God: I have put my trust in the Lord GOD ,

1.verse: O God, why hast thou cast us off for ever?

2.verse: Remember thy congregation, which thou hast purchased of old;

3.verse: Lift up thy feet unto the perpetual desolations;

4.verse: Thine enemies roar in the midst of thy congregations;

5.verse: A man was famous according as he had lifted up axes upon the thick trees.

6.verse: But now they break down the carved work

7.verse: They have cast fire into thy sanctuary,

8.verse: They said in their hearts, Let us destroy them together:

9.verse: We see not our signs: There is no more any prophet:

10.verse: O God, how long shall the adversary reproach?

11.verse: Why withdrawest thou thy hand, even thy right hand?

12.verse: For God is my King of old,

13.verse: Thou didst divide the sea by thy strength:

14.verse: Thou brakest the heads of leviathan in pieces,

15.verse: Thou didst cleave the fountain and the flood:

16.verse: The day is thine, the night also is thine:

17.verse: Thou hast set all the borders of the earth:

18.verse: Remember this, that the enemy hath reproached, O LORD ,

19.verse: O deliver not the soul of thy turtledove unto the multitude of the wicked:

20.verse: Have respect unto the covenant:

21.verse: O let not the oppressed return ashamed:

22.verse: Arise, O God, plead thine own cause:

23.verse: Forget not the voice of thine enemies:

1.verse: Unto thee, O God, do we give thanks,

2.verse: When I shall receive the congregation

3.verse: The earth and all the inhabitants thereof are dissolved:

4.verse: I said unto the fools, Deal not foolishly:

5.verse: Lift not up your horn on high:

6.verse: For promotion cometh neither from the east, nor from the west,

7.verse: But God is the judge:

8.verse: For in the hand of the LORD  there is a cup, and the wine is red;

9.verse: But I will declare for ever; I will sing praises to the God of Jacob.

10.verse: All the horns of the wicked also will I cut off;

1.verse: In Judah is God known:

2.verse: In Salem also is his tabernacle,

3.verse: There brake he the arrows of the bow,

4.verse: Thou art more glorious and excellent

5.verse: The stouthearted are spoiled, they have slept their sleep:

6.verse: At thy rebuke, O God of Jacob,

7.verse: Thou, even thou, art to be feared:

8.verse: Thou didst cause judgment to be heard from heaven;

9.verse: When God arose to judgment,

10.verse: Surely the wrath of man shall praise thee:

11.verse: Vow, and pay unto the LORD your God: Let all that be round about him

12.verse: He shall cut off the spirit of princes:

1.verse: I Cried unto God with my voice,

2.verse: In the day of my trouble I sought the Lord:

3.verse: I remembered God, and was troubled:

4.verse: Thou holdest mine eyes waking:

5.verse: I have considered the days of old,

6.verse: I call to remembrance my song in the night:

7.verse: Will the Lord cast off for ever?

8.verse: Is his mercy clean gone for ever?

9.verse: Hath God forgotten to be gracious?

10.verse: And I said, This is my infirmity:

11.verse: I will remember the works of the LORD :

12.verse: I will meditate also of all thy work,

13.verse: Thy way, O God, is in the sanctuary:

14.verse: Thou art the God that doest wonders:

15.verse: Thou hast with thine arm redeemed thy people,

16.verse: The waters saw thee, O God, the waters saw thee; they were afraid:

17.verse: The clouds poured out water: The skies sent out a sound:

18.verse: The voice of thy thunder was in the heaven:

19.verse: Thy way is in the sea, and thy path in the great waters,

20.verse: Thou leddest thy people like a flock

1.verse: Give ear, O my people, to my law:

2.verse: I will open my mouth in a parable:

3.verse: Which we have heard and known,

4.verse: We will not hide them from their children, shewing to the generation to come,

5.verse: For he established a testimony in Jacob, and appointed a law in Israel,

6.verse: That the generation to come might know them ,

7.verse: That they might set their hope in God,

8.verse: And might not be as their fathers, a stubborn and rebellious generation;

9.verse: The children of Ephraim, being armed, and carrying bows,

10.verse: They kept not the covenant of God,

11.verse: And forgat his works,

12.verse: Marvellous things did he in the sight of their fathers, in the land of Egypt,

13.verse: He divided the sea, and caused them to pass through;

14.verse: In the daytime also he led them with a cloud,

15.verse: He clave the rocks in the wilderness,

16.verse: He brought streams also out of the rock,

17.verse: And they sinned yet more against him

18.verse: And they tempted God in their heart

19.verse: Yea, they spake against God;

20.verse: Behold, he smote the rock, that the waters gushed out, and the streams overflowed;

21.verse: Therefore the LORD heard this , and was wroth:

22.verse: Because they believed not in God,

23.verse: Though he had commanded the clouds from above,

24.verse: And had rained down manna upon them to eat,

26.verse: He caused an east wind to blow in the heaven:

27.verse: He rained flesh also upon them as dust,

28.verse: And he let it fall in the midst of their camp,

29.verse: So they did eat, and were well filled: For he gave them their own desire;

30.verse: They were not estranged from their lust.

31.verse: The wrath of God came upon them, and slew the fattest of them,

32.verse: For all this they sinned still,

33.verse: Therefore their days did he consume in vanity,

34.verse: When he slew them, then they sought him:

35.verse: And they remembered that God was their rock,

36.verse: Nevertheless they did flatter him with their mouth,

37.verse: For their heart was not right with him,

38.verse: But he, being full of compassion,

39.verse: For he remembered that they were but flesh;

40.verse: How oft did they provoke him in the wilderness,

41.verse: Yea, they turned back and tempted God,

43.verse: How he had wrought his signs in Egypt,

44.verse: And had turned their rivers into blood;

45.verse: He sent divers sorts of flies among them, which devoured them;

46.verse: He gave also their increase unto the caterpiller,

47.verse: He destroyed their vines with hail,

48.verse: He gave up their cattle also to the hail,

49.verse: He cast upon them the fierceness of his anger, wrath, and indignation, and trouble,

50.verse: He made a way to his anger; He spared not their soul from death,

51.verse: And smote all the firstborn in Egypt;

52.verse: But made his own people to go forth like sheep,

53.verse: And he led them on safely, so that they feared not:

54.verse: And he brought them to the border of his sanctuary,

55.verse: He cast out the heathen also before them,

56.verse: Yet they tempted and provoked the most high God,

57.verse: But turned back, and dealt unfaithfully like their fathers:

58.verse: For they provoked him to anger with their high places,

59.verse: When God heard this , he was wroth,

60.verse: So that he forsook the tabernacle of Shiloh,

61.verse: And delivered his strength into captivity,

62.verse: He gave his people over also unto the sword;

63.verse: The fire consumed their young men;

64.verse: Their priests fell by the sword;

65.verse: Then the Lord awaked as one out of sleep,

66.verse: And he smote his enemies in the hinder parts:

67.verse: Moreover he refused the tabernacle of Joseph,

68.verse: But chose the tribe of Judah,

69.verse: And he built his sanctuary like high palaces ,

70.verse: He chose David also his servant,

71.verse: From following the ewes great with young he brought him

72.verse: So he fed them according to the integrity of his heart;

1.verse: O God, the heathen are come into thine inheritance;

2.verse: The dead bodies of thy servants have they given to be meat unto the fowls of the heaven,

3.verse: Their blood have they shed like water round about Jerusalem;

4.verse: We are become a reproach to our neighbours,

5.verse: How long, LORD ? Wilt thou be angry for ever?

6.verse: Pour out thy wrath upon the heathen that have not known thee,

7.verse: For they have devoured Jacob,

8.verse: O remember not against us former iniquities: Let thy tender mercies speedily prevent us:

9.verse: Help us, O God of our salvation, for the glory of thy name:

10.verse: Wherefore should the heathen say,

11.verse: Let the sighing of the prisoner come before thee;

12.verse: And render unto our neighbours sevenfold into their bosom

13.verse: So we thy people and sheep of thy pasture will give thee thanks for ever:

1.verse: Give ear, O Shepherd of Israel, thou that leadest Joseph like a flock;

2.verse: Before Ephraim and Benjamin and Manasseh stir up thy strength,

3.verse: Turn us again, O God,

4.verse: O LORD God of hosts,

5.verse: Thou feedest them with the bread of tears;

6.verse: Thou makest us a strife unto our neighbours:

7.verse: Turn us again, O God of hosts,

8.verse: Thou hast brought a vine out of Egypt:

9.verse: Thou preparedst room before it,

10.verse: The hills were covered with the shadow of it,

11.verse: She sent out her boughs unto the sea,

12.verse: Why hast thou then broken down her hedges,

13.verse: The boar out of the wood doth waste it,

14.verse: Return, we beseech thee, O God of hosts: Look down from heaven,

15.verse: And the vineyard which thy right hand hath planted,

16.verse: It is burned with fire, it is cut down:

17.verse: Let thy hand be upon the man of thy right hand,

18.verse: So will not we go back from thee:

19.verse: Turn us again, O LORD God of hosts,

1.verse: Sing aloud unto God our strength:

2.verse: Take a psalm, and bring hither the timbrel,

3.verse: Blow up the trumpet in the new moon,

4.verse: For this was a statute for Israel,

5.verse: This he ordained in Joseph for a testimony,

6.verse: I removed his shoulder from the burden:

7.verse: Thou calledst in trouble, and I delivered thee;

8.verse: Hear, O my people, and I will testify unto thee:

9.verse: There shall no strange god be in thee;

10.verse: I am the LORD thy God, which brought thee out of the land of Egypt:

11.verse: But my people would not hearken to my voice;

12.verse: So I gave them up unto their own hearts' lust:

13.verse: Oh that my people had hearkened unto me,

14.verse: I should soon have subdued their enemies,

15.verse: The haters of the LORD should have submitted themselves unto him:

16.verse: He should have fed them also with the finest of the wheat:

1.verse: God standeth in the congregation of the mighty;

2.verse: How long will ye judge unjustly,

3.verse: Defend the poor and fatherless:

4.verse: Deliver the poor and needy:

5.verse: They know not, neither will they understand; They walk on in darkness:

6.verse: I have said, Ye are gods;

7.verse: But ye shall die like men,

8.verse: Arise, O God, judge the earth:

1.verse: Keep not thou silence, O God:

2.verse: For, lo, thine enemies make a tumult:

3.verse: They have taken crafty counsel against thy people,

4.verse: They have said, Come, and let us cut them off from being a nation;

5.verse: For they have consulted together with one consent:

6.verse: The tabernacles of Edom, and the Ishmaelites;

7.verse: Gebal, and Ammon, and Amalek;

8.verse: Assur also is joined with them:

9.verse: Do unto them as unto the Midianites;

10.verse: Which perished at Endor:

11.verse: Make their nobles like Oreb, and like Zeeb:

12.verse: Who said, Let us take to ourselves

13.verse: O my God, make them like a wheel;

14.verse: As the fire burneth a wood,

15.verse: So persecute them with thy tempest,

16.verse: Fill their faces with shame;

17.verse: Let them be confounded and troubled for ever;

18.verse: That men may know that thou, whose name alone is JEHOVAH,

1.verse: How amiable are thy tabernacles, O LORD of hosts!

2.verse: My soul longeth, yea, even fainteth for the courts of the LORD :

3.verse: Yea, the sparrow hath found an house, and the swallow a nest for herself, where she may lay her young,

4.verse: Blessed are they that dwell in thy house:

5.verse: Blessed is the man whose strength is

6.verse: Who passing through the valley of Baca make it a well;

7.verse: They go from strength to strength,

8.verse: O LORD God of hosts, hear my prayer:

9.verse: Behold, O God our shield,

10.verse: For a day in thy courts

11.verse: For the LORD God is a sun and shield:

12.verse: O LORD of hosts,

1.verse: LORD , thou hast been favourable unto thy land:

2.verse: Thou hast forgiven the iniquity of thy people,

3.verse: Thou hast taken away all thy wrath:

4.verse: Turn us, O God of our salvation,

5.verse: Wilt thou be angry with us for ever?

6.verse: Wilt thou not revive us again:

7.verse: Shew us thy mercy, O LORD ,

8.verse: I will hear what God the LORD will speak:

9.verse: Surely his salvation is nigh them that fear him;

10.verse: Mercy and truth are met together;

11.verse: Truth shall spring out of the earth;

12.verse: Yea, the LORD shall give that which is good;

13.verse: Righteousness shall go before him;

1.verse: Bow down thine ear, O LORD , hear me:

2.verse: Preserve my soul; for I am holy:

3.verse: Be merciful unto me, O Lord:

4.verse: Rejoice the soul of thy servant:

5.verse: For thou, Lord, art good, and ready to forgive;

6.verse: Give ear, O LORD , unto my prayer;

7.verse: In the day of my trouble I will call upon thee:

8.verse: Among the gods there is none like unto thee, O Lord;

9.verse: All nations whom thou hast made shall come and worship before thee, O Lord;

10.verse: For thou art great, and doest wondrous things:

11.verse: Teach me thy way, O LORD ; I will walk in thy truth:

12.verse: I will praise thee, O Lord my God, with all my heart:

13.verse: For great is thy mercy toward me:

14.verse: O God, the proud are risen against me,

15.verse: But thou, O Lord, art a God full of compassion, and gracious,

16.verse: O turn unto me, and have mercy upon me;

17.verse: Shew me a token for good; That they which hate me may see it , and be ashamed:

1.verse: His foundation is in the holy mountains.

2.verse: The LORD loveth the gates of Zion more than all the dwellings of Jacob.

3.verse: Glorious things are spoken of thee,

4.verse: I will make mention of Rahab and Babylon to them that know me:

5.verse: And of Zion it shall be said, This and that man was born in her:

6.verse: The LORD shall count, when he writeth up the people,

7.verse: As well the singers as the players on instruments shall be there:

1.verse: O LORD God of my salvation, I have cried day and night before thee:

2.verse: Let my prayer come before thee: Incline thine ear unto my cry;

3.verse: For my soul is full of troubles:

4.verse: I am counted with them that go down into the pit:

5.verse: Free among the dead, like the slain that lie in the grave,

6.verse: Thou hast laid me in the lowest pit,

7.verse: Thy wrath lieth hard upon me,

8.verse: Thou hast put away mine acquaintance far from me;

9.verse: Mine eye mourneth by reason of affliction:

10.verse: Wilt thou shew wonders to the dead?

11.verse: Shall thy lovingkindness be declared in the grave?

12.verse: Shall thy wonders be known in the dark?

13.verse: But unto thee have I cried, O LORD ;

14.verse: LORD , why castest thou off my soul?

15.verse: I am afflicted and ready to die

16.verse: Thy fierce wrath goeth over me;

17.verse: They came round about me daily like water;

18.verse: Lover and friend hast thou put far from me,

1.verse: I will sing of the mercies of the LORD for ever:

2.verse: For I have said, Mercy shall be built up for ever:

3.verse: I have made a covenant with my chosen,

4.verse: Thy seed will I establish for ever,

5.verse: And the heavens shall praise thy wonders, O LORD :

6.verse: For who in the heaven

7.verse: God is greatly to be feared in the assembly of the saints,

8.verse: O LORD God of hosts, who is a strong LORD like unto thee?

9.verse: Thou rulest the raging of the sea:

10.verse: Thou hast broken Rahab in pieces, as one that is slain;

11.verse: The heavens are thine, the earth also is thine:

12.verse: The north and the south thou hast created them:

13.verse: Thou hast a mighty arm:

14.verse: Justice and judgment are the habitation of thy throne:

15.verse: Blessed is the people that know the joyful sound:

16.verse: In thy name shall they rejoice all the day:

17.verse: For thou art the glory of their strength:

18.verse: For the LORD  is our defence;

19.verse: Then thou spakest in vision to thy holy one, and saidst,

20.verse: I have found David my servant;

21.verse: With whom my hand shall be established:

22.verse: The enemy shall not exact upon him;

23.verse: And I will beat down his foes before his face,

24.verse: But my faithfulness and my mercy shall be with him:

25.verse: I will set his hand also in the sea,

26.verse: He shall cry unto me, Thou art my father,

27.verse: Also I will make him my firstborn,

28.verse: My mercy will I keep for him for evermore,

29.verse: His seed also will I make to endure for ever,

30.verse: If his children forsake my law,
