31.verse: If they break my statutes, and keep not my commandments;

32.verse: Then will I visit their transgression with the rod, and their iniquity with stripes.

33.verse: Nevertheless my lovingkindness will I not utterly take from him,

34.verse: My covenant will I not break, nor alter the thing that is gone out of my lips.

35.verse: Once have I sworn by my holiness that I will not lie unto David.

36.verse: His seed shall endure for ever,

37.verse: It shall be established for ever as the moon,

38.verse: But thou hast cast off and abhorred,

39.verse: Thou hast made void the covenant of thy servant:

40.verse: Thou hast broken down all his hedges;

41.verse: All that pass by the way spoil him:

42.verse: Thou hast set up the right hand of his adversaries;

43.verse: Thou hast also turned the edge of his sword,

44.verse: Thou hast made his glory to cease,

45.verse: The days of his youth hast thou shortened:

46.verse: How long, LORD ? wilt thou hide thyself for ever?

47.verse: Remember how short my time is:

48.verse: What man is he that liveth, and shall not see death?

49.verse: Lord, where are thy former lovingkindnesses,

50.verse: Remember, Lord, the reproach of thy servants;

51.verse: Wherewith thine enemies have reproached, O LORD ;

52.verse: Blessed be the LORD for evermore.

1.verse: LORD , thou hast been our dwelling place

2.verse: Before the mountains were brought forth, or ever thou hadst formed the earth and the world,

3.verse: Thou turnest man to destruction;

4.verse: For a thousand years in thy sight are but as yesterday

5.verse: Thou carriest them away as with a flood; they are as a sleep:

6.verse: In the morning it flourisheth, and groweth up;

7.verse: For we are consumed by thine anger,

8.verse: Thou hast set our iniquities before thee,

9.verse: For all our days are passed away in thy wrath:

10.verse: The days of our years are threescore years and ten; And if by reason of strength they be fourscore years,

11.verse: Who knoweth the power of thine anger?

12.verse: So teach us to number our days,

13.verse: Return, O LORD , how long?

14.verse: O satisfy us early with thy mercy;

15.verse: Make us glad according to the days wherein thou hast afflicted us,

16.verse: Let thy work appear unto thy servants,

17.verse: And let the beauty of the LORD our God be upon us:

1.verse: He that dwelleth in the secret place of the Most High

2.verse: I will say of the LORD , He is my refuge and my fortress:

3.verse: Surely he shall deliver thee from the snare of the fowler,

4.verse: He shall cover thee with his feathers, and under his wings shalt thou trust:

5.verse: Thou shalt not be afraid for the terror by night;

6.verse: Nor for the pestilence that walketh in darkness;

7.verse: A thousand shall fall at thy side, and ten thousand at thy right hand;

8.verse: Only with thine eyes shalt thou behold

9.verse: Because thou hast made the LORD , which is my refuge,

10.verse: There shall no evil befall thee,

11.verse: For he shall give his angels charge over thee,

12.verse: They shall bear thee up in their hands,

13.verse: Thou shalt tread upon the lion and adder:

14.verse: Because he hath set his love upon me, therefore will I deliver him:

15.verse: He shall call upon me, and I will answer him:

16.verse: With long life will I satisfy him,

1.verse: It is a good thing to give thanks unto the LORD ,

2.verse: To shew forth thy lovingkindness in the morning,

3.verse: Upon an instrument of ten strings, and upon the psaltery;

4.verse: For thou, LORD , hast made me glad through thy work:

5.verse: O LORD , how great are thy works!

6.verse: A brutish man knoweth not;

7.verse: When the wicked spring as the grass,

8.verse: But thou, LORD , art most high for evermore.

9.verse: For, lo, thine enemies, O LORD , for, lo, thine enemies shall perish;

10.verse: But my horn shalt thou exalt like the horn of an unicorn:

11.verse: Mine eye also shall see my desire on mine enemies,

12.verse: The righteous shall flourish like the palm tree:

13.verse: Those that be planted in the house of the LORD

14.verse: They shall still bring forth fruit in old age;

15.verse: To shew that the LORD  is upright: He is my rock,

1.verse: The LORD reigneth, he is clothed with majesty;

2.verse: Thy throne is established of old:

3.verse: The floods have lifted up, O LORD , the floods have lifted up their voice;

4.verse: The LORD on high is mightier than the noise of many waters,

5.verse: Thy testimonies are very sure:

1.verse: O LORD God, to whom vengeance belongeth;

2.verse: Lift up thyself, thou judge of the earth:

3.verse: LORD , how long shall the wicked,

4.verse: How long shall they utter and speak hard things?

5.verse: They break in pieces thy people, O LORD ,

6.verse: They slay the widow and the stranger,

7.verse: Yet they say, The LORD shall not see,

8.verse: Understand, ye brutish among the people:

9.verse: He that planted the ear, shall he not hear?

10.verse: He that chastiseth the heathen, shall not he correct?

11.verse: The LORD knoweth the thoughts of man,

12.verse: Blessed is the man whom thou chastenest, O LORD ,

13.verse: That thou mayest give him rest from the days of adversity,

14.verse: For the LORD will not cast off his people,

15.verse: But judgment shall return unto righteousness:

16.verse: Who will rise up for me against the evildoers?

17.verse: Unless the LORD  had been my help,

18.verse: When I said, My foot slippeth;

19.verse: In the multitude of my thoughts within me

20.verse: Shall the throne of iniquity have fellowship with thee,

21.verse: They gather themselves together against the soul of the righteous,

22.verse: But the LORD is my defence;

23.verse: And he shall bring upon them their own iniquity, and shall cut them off in their own wickedness;

1.verse: O come, let us sing unto the LORD :

2.verse: Let us come before his presence with thanksgiving,

3.verse: For the LORD  is a great God,

4.verse: In his hand are the deep places of the earth:

5.verse: The sea is his, and he made it:

6.verse: O come, let us worship and bow down:

7.verse: For he is our God;

8.verse: Harden not your heart,

9.verse: When your fathers tempted me,

10.verse: Forty years long was I grieved with this generation,

11.verse: Unto whom I sware in my wrath

1.verse: O Sing unto the LORD a new song:

2.verse: Sing unto the LORD , bless his name;

3.verse: Declare his glory among the heathen,

4.verse: For the LORD  is great, and greatly to be praised:

5.verse: For all the gods of the nations are idols:

6.verse: Honour and majesty are before him:

7.verse: Give unto the LORD , O ye kindreds of the people,

8.verse: Give unto the LORD the glory due unto his name:

9.verse: O worship the LORD in the beauty of holiness:

10.verse: Say among the heathen that the LORD reigneth:

11.verse: Let the heavens rejoice, and let the earth be glad;

12.verse: Let the field be joyful, and all that is therein:

13.verse: Before the LORD : for he cometh, for he cometh to judge the earth:

1.verse: The LORD reigneth; let the earth rejoice;

2.verse: Clouds and darkness are round about him:

3.verse: A fire goeth before him,

4.verse: His lightnings enlightened the world:

5.verse: The hills melted like wax at the presence of the LORD ,

6.verse: The heavens declare his righteousness,

7.verse: Confounded be all they that serve graven images,

8.verse: Zion heard, and was glad;

9.verse: For thou, LORD , art high above all the earth:

10.verse: Ye that love the LORD , hate evil:

11.verse: Light is sown for the righteous,

12.verse: Rejoice in the LORD , ye righteous;

1.verse: O sing unto the LORD a new song;

2.verse: The LORD hath made known his salvation:

3.verse: He hath remembered his mercy and his truth toward the house of Israel:

4.verse: Make a joyful noise unto the LORD , all the earth:

5.verse: Sing unto the LORD with the harp;

6.verse: With trumpets and sound of cornet

7.verse: Let the sea roar, and the fulness thereof;

8.verse: Let the floods clap their hands: Let the hills be joyful together

9.verse: Before the LORD ;

1.verse: The LORD reigneth; let the people tremble:

2.verse: The LORD  is great in Zion;

3.verse: Let them praise thy great and terrible name;

4.verse: The king's strength also loveth judgment; Thou dost establish equity,

5.verse: Exalt ye the LORD our God,

6.verse: Moses and Aaron among his priests, and Samuel among them that call upon his name;

7.verse: He spake unto them in the cloudy pillar:

8.verse: Thou answeredst them, O LORD our God:

9.verse: Exalt the LORD our God, and worship at his holy hill;

1.verse: Make a joyful noise unto the LORD , all ye lands.

2.verse: Serve the LORD with gladness: Come before his presence with singing.

3.verse: Know ye that the LORD he is God:

4.verse: Enter into his gates with thanksgiving, And into his courts with praise:

5.verse: For the LORD  is good; his mercy is everlasting;

1.verse: I will sing of mercy and judgment:

2.verse: I will behave myself wisely

3.verse: I will set no wicked thing before mine eyes: I hate the work of them that turn aside;

4.verse: A froward heart shall depart from me:

5.verse: Whoso privily slandereth his neighbour,

6.verse: Mine eyes shall be upon the faithful

7.verse: He that worketh deceit shall not dwell within my house:

8.verse: I will early destroy all the wicked of the land; That I may cut off

1.verse: Hear my prayer, O LORD ,

2.verse: Hide not thy face from me in the day when I am in trouble;

3.verse: For my days are consumed like smoke,

4.verse: My heart is smitten, and withered like grass;

5.verse: By reason of the voice of my groaning

6.verse: I am like a pelican of the wilderness:

7.verse: I watch, and am as a sparrow

8.verse: Mine enemies reproach me all the day;

9.verse: For I have eaten ashes like bread,

10.verse: Because of thine indignation and thy wrath:

11.verse: My days are like a shadow that declineth;

12.verse: But thou, O LORD , shalt endure for ever;

13.verse: Thou shalt arise, and have mercy upon Zion:

14.verse: For thy servants take pleasure in her stones,

15.verse: So the heathen shall fear the name of the LORD ,

16.verse: When the LORD shall build up Zion,

17.verse: He will regard the prayer of the destitute,

18.verse: This shall be written for the generation to come:

19.verse: For he hath looked down from the height of his sanctuary;

20.verse: To hear the groaning of the prisoner;

21.verse: To declare the name of the LORD in Zion,

22.verse: When the people are gathered together,

23.verse: He weakened my strength in the way;

24.verse: I said, O my God, take me not away in the midst of my days:

25.verse: Of old hast thou laid the foundation of the earth:

26.verse: They shall perish, but thou shalt endure:

27.verse: But thou art the same, and thy years shall have no end.

28.verse: The children of thy servants shall continue,

1.verse: Bless the LORD , O my soul:

2.verse: Bless the LORD , O my soul,

3.verse: Who forgiveth all thine iniquities;

4.verse: Who redeemeth thy life from destruction;

5.verse: Who satisfieth thy mouth with good things ;

6.verse: The LORD executeth righteousness and judgment

7.verse: He made known his ways unto Moses,

8.verse: The LORD  is merciful and gracious,

9.verse: He will not always chide:

10.verse: He hath not dealt with us after our sins;

11.verse: For as the heaven is high above the earth,

12.verse: As far as the east is from the west,

13.verse: Like as a father pitieth his children,

14.verse: For he knoweth our frame;

15.verse: As for man, his days are as grass:

16.verse: For the wind passeth over it, and it is gone;

17.verse: But the mercy of the LORD  is from everlasting to everlasting upon them that fear him,

18.verse: To such as keep his covenant,

19.verse: The LORD hath prepared his throne in the heavens;

20.verse: Bless the LORD , ye his angels, that excel in strength,

21.verse: Bless ye the LORD , all ye his hosts;

22.verse: Bless the LORD , all his works in all places of his dominion:

1.verse: Bless the LORD , O my soul.

2.verse: Who coverest thyself with light as with a garment:

3.verse: Who layeth the beams of his chambers in the waters:

4.verse: Who maketh his angels spirits;

5.verse: Who laid the foundations of the earth,

6.verse: Thou coveredst it with the deep as with a garment:

7.verse: At thy rebuke they fled;

8.verse: They go up by the mountains; they go down by the valleys

9.verse: Thou hast set a bound that they may not pass over;

10.verse: He sendeth the springs into the valleys,

11.verse: They give drink to every beast of the field:

12.verse: By them shall the fowls of the heaven have their habitation,

13.verse: He watereth the hills from his chambers:

14.verse: He causeth the grass to grow for the cattle,

15.verse: And wine that maketh glad the heart of man,

16.verse: The trees of the LORD are full of sap ;

17.verse: Where the birds make their nests:

18.verse: The high hills are a refuge for the wild goats;

19.verse: He appointed the moon for seasons:

20.verse: Thou makest darkness, and it is night:

21.verse: The young lions roar after their prey,

22.verse: The sun ariseth, they gather themselves together,

23.verse: Man goeth forth unto his work

24.verse: O LORD , how manifold are thy works!

25.verse: So is this great and wide sea,

26.verse: There go the ships: There is that leviathan,

28.verse: That thou givest them they gather:

29.verse: Thou hidest thy face, they are troubled:

30.verse: Thou sendest forth thy spirit, they are created:

31.verse: The glory of the LORD shall endure for ever:

32.verse: He looketh on the earth, and it trembleth:

33.verse: I will sing unto the LORD as long as I live:

34.verse: My meditation of him shall be sweet:

35.verse: Let the sinners be consumed out of the earth, and let the wicked be no more.

1.verse: O give thanks unto the LORD ; call upon his name:

2.verse: Sing unto him, sing psalms unto him:

3.verse: Glory ye in his holy name:

4.verse: Seek the LORD , and his strength:

5.verse: Remember his marvellous works that he hath done;

6.verse: O ye seed of Abraham his servant,

7.verse: He is the LORD our God:

8.verse: He hath remembered his covenant for ever,

9.verse: Which covenant he made with Abraham,

10.verse: And confirmed the same unto Jacob for a law,

11.verse: Saying, Unto thee will I give the land of Canaan,

12.verse: When they were but a few men in number;

13.verse: When they went from one nation to another,

14.verse: He suffered no man to do them wrong:

15.verse: Saying , Touch not mine anointed,

16.verse: Moreover he called for a famine upon the land:

17.verse: He sent a man before them,

18.verse: Whose feet they hurt with fetters:

19.verse: Until the time that his word came:

20.verse: The king sent and loosed him;

21.verse: He made him lord of his house,

22.verse: To bind his princes at his pleasure;

23.verse: Israel also came into Egypt;

24.verse: And he increased his people greatly;

25.verse: He turned their heart to hate his people,

27.verse: They shewed his signs among them,

28.verse: He sent darkness, and made it dark;

29.verse: He turned their waters into blood,

30.verse: Their land brought forth frogs in abundance,

31.verse: He spake, and there came divers sorts of flies,

32.verse: He gave them hail for rain,

33.verse: He smote their vines also and their fig trees;

34.verse: He spake, and the locusts came, and caterpillers, and that without number,

35.verse: And did eat up all the herbs in their land, and devoured the fruit of their ground.

36.verse: He smote also all the firstborn in their land,

37.verse: He brought them forth also with silver and gold:

38.verse: Egypt was glad when they departed:

39.verse: He spread a cloud for a covering;

40.verse: The people asked, and he brought quails,

41.verse: He opened the rock, and the waters gushed out;

42.verse: For he remembered his holy promise,

43.verse: And he brought forth his people with joy,

44.verse: And gave them the lands of the heathen:

45.verse: That they might observe his statutes,

1.verse: Praise ye the LORD . O give thanks unto the LORD ; for he is good:

2.verse: Who can utter the mighty acts of the LORD ?

3.verse: Blessed are they that keep judgment,

4.verse: Remember me, O LORD , with the favour that thou bearest unto thy people:

5.verse: That I may see the good of thy chosen,

6.verse: We have sinned with our fathers,

7.verse: Our fathers understood not thy wonders in Egypt; They remembered not the multitude of thy mercies;

8.verse: Nevertheless he saved them for his name's sake,

9.verse: He rebuked the Red sea also, and it was dried up:

10.verse: And he saved them from the hand of him that hated them ,

11.verse: And the waters covered their enemies:

12.verse: Then believed they his words;

13.verse: They soon forgat his works;

14.verse: But lusted exceedingly in the wilderness,

15.verse: And he gave them their request;

16.verse: They envied Moses also in the camp,

17.verse: The earth opened and swallowed up Dathan,

18.verse: And a fire was kindled in their company;

19.verse: They made a calf in Horeb,

20.verse: Thus they changed their glory

21.verse: They forgat God their saviour,

22.verse: Wondrous works in the land of Ham,

23.verse: Therefore he said that he would destroy them, had not Moses his chosen stood before him in the breach,

24.verse: Yea, they despised the pleasant land,

26.verse: Therefore he lifted up his hand against them,

27.verse: To overthrow their seed also among the nations,

28.verse: They joined themselves also unto Baalpeor,

29.verse: Thus they provoked him to anger with their inventions:

30.verse: Then stood up Phinehas, and executed judgment:

31.verse: And that was counted unto him for righteousness

32.verse: They angered him also at the waters of strife,

34.verse: They did not destroy the nations,

36.verse: And they served their idols: Which were a snare unto them.

37.verse: Yea, they sacrificed their sons and their daughters unto devils,

38.verse: And shed innocent blood, Even the blood of their sons and of their daughters,

39.verse: Thus were they defiled with their own works,

40.verse: Therefore was the wrath of the LORD kindled against his people,

41.verse: And he gave them into the hand of the heathen;

43.verse: Many times did he deliver them;

45.verse: And he remembered for them his covenant, and repented according to the multitude of his mercies.

46.verse: He made them also to be pitied of all those that carried them captives.

47.verse: Save us, O LORD our God, and gather us from among the heathen,

48.verse: Blessed be the LORD God of Israel from everlasting to everlasting:

1.verse: O give thanks unto the LORD , for he is good:

2.verse: Let the redeemed of the LORD say so ,

3.verse: And gathered them out of the lands, from the east, and from the west,

4.verse: They wandered in the wilderness in a solitary way;

5.verse: Hungry and thirsty,

6.verse: Then they cried unto the LORD in their trouble,

7.verse: And he led them forth by the right way,

8.verse: Oh that men would praise the LORD  for his goodness,

9.verse: For he satisfieth the longing soul,

10.verse: Such as sit in darkness and in the shadow of death,

11.verse: Because they rebelled against the words of God,

12.verse: Therefore he brought down their heart with labour;

13.verse: Then they cried unto the LORD in their trouble,

14.verse: He brought them out of darkness and the shadow of death,

15.verse: Oh that men would praise the LORD  for his goodness,

16.verse: For he hath broken the gates of brass,

17.verse: Fools because of their transgression,

18.verse: Their soul abhorreth all manner of meat;

19.verse: Then they cry unto the LORD in their trouble,

20.verse: He sent his word, and healed them,

21.verse: Oh that men would praise the LORD  for his goodness,

22.verse: And let them sacrifice the sacrifices of thanksgiving,

23.verse: They that go down to the sea in ships,

24.verse: These see the works of the LORD ,

25.verse: For he commandeth, and raiseth the stormy wind,

26.verse: They mount up to the heaven, they go down again to the depths:

27.verse: They reel to and fro, and stagger like a drunken man,

28.verse: Then they cry unto the LORD in their trouble,

29.verse: He maketh the storm a calm,

30.verse: Then are they glad because they be quiet;

31.verse: Oh that men would praise the LORD  for his goodness,

32.verse: Let them exalt him also in the congregation of the people,

33.verse: He turneth rivers into a wilderness,

35.verse: He turneth the wilderness into a standing water,

36.verse: And there he maketh the hungry

37.verse: And sow the fields, and plant vineyards,

38.verse: He blesseth them also, so that they are multiplied greatly;

39.verse: Again, they are minished and brought low

41.verse: Yet setteth he the poor on high from affliction,

42.verse: The righteous shall see it , and rejoice:

43.verse: Whoso is wise, and will observe these things ,

1.verse: O God, my heart is fixed;

2.verse: Awake, psaltery and harp:

3.verse: I will praise thee, O LORD , among the people:

4.verse: For thy mercy is great above the heavens:

5.verse: Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens:

6.verse: That thy beloved may be delivered:

7.verse: God hath spoken in his holiness;

8.verse: Gilead is mine; Manasseh is mine;

9.verse: Moab is my washpot;

10.verse: Who will bring me into the strong city?

11.verse: Wilt not thou , O God, who hast cast us off?

12.verse: Give us help from trouble:

13.verse: Through God we shall do valiantly:

1.verse: Hold not thy peace, O God of my praise;

2.verse: For the mouth of the wicked and the mouth of the deceitful are opened against me:

3.verse: They compassed me about also with words of hatred; And fought against me without a cause.

4.verse: For my love they are my adversaries:

5.verse: And they have rewarded me evil for good,

6.verse: Set thou a wicked man over him:

7.verse: When he shall be judged, let him be condemned:

8.verse: Let his days be few;

9.verse: Let his children be fatherless,

10.verse: Let his children be continually vagabonds, and beg:

11.verse: Let the extortioner catch all that he hath;

12.verse: Let there be none to extend mercy unto him:

13.verse: Let his posterity be cut off;

14.verse: Let the iniquity of his fathers be remembered with the LORD ;

15.verse: Let them be before the LORD continually,

16.verse: Because that he remembered not to shew mercy,

17.verse: As he loved cursing, so let it come unto him:

18.verse: As he clothed himself with cursing like as with his garment,

19.verse: Let it be unto him as the garment which covereth him,

20.verse: Let this be the reward of mine adversaries from the LORD ,

21.verse: But do thou for me, O GOD the Lord, for thy name's sake:

22.verse: For I am poor and needy,

23.verse: I am gone like the shadow when it declineth:

24.verse: My knees are weak through fasting;

25.verse: I became also a reproach unto them:

26.verse: Help me, O LORD my God:

27.verse: That they may know that this is thy hand;

28.verse: Let them curse, but bless thou:

29.verse: Let mine adversaries be clothed with shame,

30.verse: I will greatly praise the LORD with my mouth;

31.verse: For he shall stand at the right hand of the poor,

1.verse: The LORD said unto my Lord,

2.verse: The LORD shall send the rod of thy strength out of Zion:

3.verse: Thy people shall be willing in the day of thy power,

4.verse: The LORD hath sworn, and will not repent,

5.verse: The Lord at thy right hand

6.verse: He shall judge among the heathen, he shall fill the places with the dead bodies;

7.verse: He shall drink of the brook in the way:

1.verse: Praise ye the LORD . I will praise the LORD with my whole heart,

2.verse: The works of the LORD  are great,

3.verse: His work is honourable and glorious:

4.verse: He hath made his wonderful works to be remembered:

5.verse: He hath given meat unto them that fear him:

6.verse: He hath shewed his people the power of his works,

7.verse: The works of his hands are verity and judgment;

8.verse: They stand fast for ever and ever,

9.verse: He sent redemption unto his people:

10.verse: The fear of the LORD  is the beginning of wisdom:

1.verse: Praise ye the LORD . Blessed is the man that feareth the LORD ,

2.verse: His seed shall be mighty upon earth:

3.verse: Wealth and riches shall be in his house:

4.verse: Unto the upright there ariseth light in the darkness:

5.verse: A good man sheweth favour, and lendeth:

6.verse: Surely he shall not be moved for ever:

7.verse: He shall not be afraid of evil tidings:

8.verse: His heart is established, he shall not be afraid,

9.verse: He hath dispersed, he hath given to the poor;

10.verse: The wicked shall see it , and be grieved;

1.verse: Praise ye the LORD . Praise, O ye servants of the LORD ,

2.verse: Blessed be the name of the LORD

3.verse: From the rising of the sun unto the going down of the same

4.verse: The LORD  is high above all nations,

5.verse: Who is like unto the LORD our God, who dwelleth on high,

6.verse: Who humbleth himself to behold the things that are in heaven, and in the earth!

7.verse: He raiseth up the poor out of the dust,

8.verse: That he may set him with princes,

9.verse: He maketh the barren woman to keep house,

1.verse: When Israel went out of Egypt,

2.verse: Judah was his sanctuary,

3.verse: The sea saw it , and fled:

4.verse: The mountains skipped like rams,

5.verse: What ailed thee, O thou sea, that thou fleddest?

6.verse: Ye mountains, that ye skipped like rams;

7.verse: Tremble, thou earth, at the presence of the Lord,

8.verse: Which turned the rock into a standing water,

1.verse: Not unto us, O LORD , not unto us, but unto thy name give glory,

2.verse: Wherefore should the heathen say,

3.verse: But our God is in the heavens:

4.verse: Their idols are silver and gold,

5.verse: They have mouths, but they speak not:

6.verse: They have ears, but they hear not:

7.verse: They have hands, but they handle not: Feet have they, but they walk not:

8.verse: They that make them are like unto them;

9.verse: O Israel, trust thou in the LORD :

10.verse: O house of Aaron, trust in the LORD :

11.verse: Ye that fear the LORD , trust in the LORD :

12.verse: The LORD hath been mindful of us: he will bless us ;

13.verse: He will bless them that fear

14.verse: The LORD shall increase you more and more,

15.verse: Ye are blessed of the LORD

16.verse: The heaven, even the heavens, are the LORD 's:

17.verse: The dead praise not the LORD ,

18.verse: But we will bless the LORD

1.verse: I love the LORD ,

2.verse: Because he hath inclined his ear unto me,

3.verse: The sorrows of death compassed me,

4.verse: Then called I upon the name of the LORD ;

5.verse: Gracious is the LORD , and righteous;

6.verse: The LORD preserveth the simple:

7.verse: Return unto thy rest, O my soul;

8.verse: For thou hast delivered my soul from death,

2.verse: Praise ye him, all his angels:

3.verse: Praise ye him, sun and moon:

4.verse: Praise him, ye heavens of heavens,

5.verse: Let them praise the name of the LORD :

6.verse: He hath also stablished them for ever and ever:

7.verse: Praise the LORD from the earth,

8.verse: Fire, and hail; snow, and vapours;

9.verse: Mountains, and all hills;

10.verse: Beasts, and all cattle;

11.verse: Kings of the earth, and all people;

12.verse: Both young men, and maidens;

13.verse: Let them praise the name of the LORD :

14.verse: He also exalteth the horn of his people,

1.verse: Praise ye the LORD . Sing unto the LORD a new song,

2.verse: Let Israel rejoice in him that made him:

3.verse: Let them praise his name in the dance:

4.verse: For the LORD taketh pleasure in his people:

5.verse: Let the saints be joyful in glory:

6.verse: Let the high praises of God be in their mouth,

7.verse: To execute vengeance upon the heathen,

8.verse: To bind their kings with chains,

9.verse: To execute upon them the judgment written:

1.verse: Praise ye the LORD . Praise God in his sanctuary:

2.verse: Praise him for his mighty acts:

3.verse: Praise him with the sound of the trumpet:

4.verse: Praise him with the timbrel and dance:

5.verse: Praise him upon the loud cymbals:

6.verse: Let every thing that hath breath
